runners.name: Atsila
runners.owner: Barry Fowler, Medallion Racing 2020 Llc, Steven I Weston
runners.comment: Bellewstown winner on debut, progressive when beating the experienced Cercene over C&D
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to Layfayette whose Pattern wins have included two at Group 2 level at this track;; dam 1m winner; debut maiden winner from an 85-rated rival at Bellewstown early last month; took the rise in class in her stride when beating the experienced Cercene over C&D early this month.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Auguste Rodin Irish EBF Athasi Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: She got into that Bellewstown race because of the auction prices and missed the kick, something you shouldn't be able to do there, come from so far back. We threw Atsila in the deep end here but she's obviously a smart filly. I was half thinking of running her in a handicap but Barry (Fowler - owner) said no lets throw her into the Athasi and see where she stands. It looked a good field, fast ground and they went a good gallop so there's no fluke about it. She's quite lazy at home so hard to judge. I think she's deserved a crack at a big one - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: California Dreamer
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Placed in three Pattern races at two, held by the less exposed Atsila on recent C&D form
runners.spotlight: Placed in three Pattern races at two, best effort when second over 6f on good ground at this venue; took advantage of a good opportunity in 1m AW maiden at Dundalk in February; dropped away in the final furlong in the 7f Fred Darling; better over 1m here last time, but held by Atsila on that running.

runners.name: Cercene

prev_owners.owner: Shane R Stafford/J C Fleming/Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd
J C Fleming & Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd

runners.comment: Solid displays behind Swelter at Leopardstown and Atsila over C&D, those two preferred
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut at Gowran last July; Naas maiden winner on second outing; failed to cope with soft ground in a C&D Group 3 on final juvenile start; two solid runs in defeat, third behind Swelter at Leopardstown, and second to Atsila; no strong reason why she should reverse form with any of those three.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden
quotes.quote: Circene looked to be going nowhere and then won well. We think she's a very good filly. The Park Stakes might come a bit soon for her, but she is in the EBF Final here in the autumn, but she might be finished for this year - Joe Murphy junior, assistant trainer.

runners.name: City Of Memphis
runners.comment: Less than three weeks since an emphatic debut win, stable flying but this is ambitious
runners.spotlight: Justified a strong home reputation with an emphatic odds-on debut at Cork; that was only 19 days ago, and this is a demanding task in the circumstances; stable in flying form.

quotes.race: Annual Membership Available Maiden
quotes.quote: City Of Memphis has plenty of ability and everything she does, she does with ease. We were confident coming here that she would run a good race and I'm delighted she has won.  We'll take her home now, and aim to go up the grades, hoping to get black-type - Paddy Twomey, trainer speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Duty First
runners.comment: 33-1 Fred Darling winner, fading when stumbling over a furlong down in the 1,000 Guineas
runners.spotlight: Winner and Group-placed at two; belied her 33-1 odds with a clear-cut success in the 7f Fred Darling at Newbury on seasonal debut; fading when stumbling over a furlong down in the 1,000 Guineas; still has to prove she stays this far.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Stakes (Registered As The Fred Darling Stakes) (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Duty First will definitely go over a mile in the 1,000 Guineas. I haven't got her in entered at Newmarket, but I'd imagine that's where she'd run. She was actually scheduled to go for the Italian Guineas, but I don't think that'll happen now. - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Duty First certainly looks capable of black type and we'll need to open up the programme book and see what's available. We fancied her going to Newmarket and she ran a nice race there in what I suspect is a pretty good maiden, and we definitely liked her chances here. She should have a bright future and hopefully she can live up to some of those entries. We'll see how she is coming back and make a plan - Oliver St Lawrence, owners' racing manager.

runners.name: Flight
runners.comment: Excellent run to take second in 1,000 Guineas one length in front of stablemate Simmering
runners.spotlight: Very consistent (22133) last season; Sandown maiden win was flanked by good efforts in races won by Desert Flower, including the May Hill; got closer than previously to the Godolphin's unbeaten star when beaten one length in the 1,000 Guineas, the same margin in front of stablemate Simmering who raced in the larger group on the far side.

quotes.race: Betfred 1000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: I'm elated. We're all here to win, but it's fantastic. There was a lot of confidence coming into this race behind the Godolphin filly - it was like she was unbeatable. There were both big prices but I was happy with what I was seeing at home and I'm so pleased they had the chance to show that today. Everything had gone well since Newbury with Simmering - we just put a line through that race - and Flight had worked here during the Craven meeting and come on a good deal. We were dealing with last year's champions so we didn't know where we stood with them, but we had faith in our fillies and you have to be delighted with what they've done - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred May Hill Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Flight travelled well. Oisin [Murphy, rider] was very happy and felt she quickened well the whole way to the line. I'd say she was just beaten by two very good fillies. She's run her race, which was a very good race. She's a big filly, she's going to keep improving. She'll either be finished for the year or we might think about the Fillies' Mile or something. She'll be one for next year, when she'll go up in trip - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Â£40,000 EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The logical next step is to go up to stakes company and something like the May Hill might suit. It comes quite soon but I think the nature of Doncaster and stepping up to a mile would be perfect for this filly, so we'll look at that as long as it doesn't come too quickly. Flight has he's taken a bit longer than the other two fillies [Celestial Orbit and Simmering] to come to hand but she's up there and the ability is there for sure - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

runners.name: Jaliyah
runners.owner: Giselle De Aguiar & Amo Racing Limited
runners.comment: Decent form this year but over longer trips and well removed from the standard needed here
runners.spotlight: Won Cork maiden over this trip on good-to-firm last autumn; had notched a win and two seconds from three runs this year but over longer trips and at a level a long way removed from Classic standard.

runners.name: January
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: 2-4 in Ireland at two, stronger form in defeat in Britain, in front of Flight in May Hill
runners.spotlight: Two wins from four Irish starts last season, notably a comfortable success over an extended 7f in a Listed race at Tipperary; stronger form in defeat in two trips to Britain; got within 1 1/2l of Desert Flower when overtaking Flight half a furlong out in the May Hill; thoroughly outpointed by the Godolphin star in the Fillies' Mile.

quotes.race: Betfred May Hill Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: January has run a good race. Sean [Levey, rider] was happy with how she handled the track. Obviously we were beaten by a very good filly - Kevin Buckley, owners' UK representative.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Churchill Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: January was always going to be suited going up to this trip. They went a good pace and she will have learned a lot. She should be very comfortable going up to a mile - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: We think she's a very good filly. She had some very good form last season and ran well when second in the Fillies' Mile on her final start. We're happy with her, she's done very well and we might look at the Park Express with her. 07-04-25

runners.name: Lake Victoria
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Star juvenile, top-level winner at three different trips, needed her Newmarket Guineas run
runners.spotlight: Star juvenile, 5-5 including Group/Grade 1 races at three different trips, namely the 7f Moyglare at this venue (good), the 6f Cheveley Park Stakes at Newmarket (soft) and 1m Breeders' Cup Juvenile Fillies Turf at Del Mar (firm); ran as if she needed it when sixth in the 1,000 Guineas; preparation was not ideal; likely to be much closer to peak form now.

quotes.race: John Deere Breeders' Cup Juvenile Fillies Turf (Grade 1) (2yo Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was an incredible performance. Lake Victoria looks very special. Ryan was very cool on her - he probably ended up further back than he wanted to be. She'd only ever run over straight tracks before and it was her first time over a mile, and Ryan gave her a brilliant ride - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Cheveley Park Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Coming back to six was not an easy thing to do. We had in our heads before the Moyglare that Lake Victoria could come back here. Ryan gave her a very uncomplicated ride and she quickened very well. She was obviously very classy, always. We thought when she went to the Curragh the first day she was very classy and she won. She came from the Curragh back here for a Group race. Sean loved her and Wayne loved her the last day. Ryan said to come back here for the Fillies' Mile. I don't know whether you could go from seven back up to six and then back up to a mile. We'll see, it'll be dependent on whatever the lads want to do really - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Lake Victoria is a very good filly. She was very green here the first day, she was impressive at Newmarket and is very classy - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Sweet Solera Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Lake Victoria is not short of speed but she hit the line strong there today. I think she has a pedigree to match all of the winners the stable has had today. I've not won in these Michael Tabor silks for a long time so it's nice to get back in the groove - Sean Levey, rider.

quotes.race: Kildare House Hotel Irish EBF Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Lake Victoria had shown lovely work at home. Ryan was very happy with her. When she got there she began to prick her ears and they were still pricked going to the line. She will go to one of the good fillies races - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She had a longer break than the others because her year was very long, ending up at the Breeders' Cup, where she made it five wins out of five. I'm not sure she'll make the Guineas but we're training her for it and I wouldn't rule her out because she usually comes quickly and she is starting to come, so we'll see. If she doesn't come in time, she'll go to the Athasi the day after at the Curragh. 07-04-25

runners.name: Simmering

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Bv Sangster,Justin Casse & Dr J Berk

runners.comment: Third in the 1,000 Guineas, superior to runner-up and stablemate Flight on juvenile form
runners.spotlight: Solid juvenile campaign featured Group wins over 6f/7f in Britain/France and a good second to Lake Victoria over 7f at this track in the Moyglare; fourth in the Prix Marcel Boussac; doubts raised by a tame run in the Fred Darling on reappearance; left that form behind when third in the 1,000 Guineas, one length behind stablemate Flight.

quotes.race: Prix du Calvados (Group 2) (2yo Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was an easier watch than the Princess Margaret. Dylan [Browne McMonagle] said Simmering probably hit the front a bit soon but he didn't have anything else to take him into the race, and she maybe looked a round a bit. I think she will be a better filly on better ground but she seemed to handle it okay here today. This is only my second ever foreign runner and she's my first Group 2 winner so it's nice to have a flagbearer like that in the yard. I think she's still progressive, she's a big filly and it's exciting. Seven furlongs was a new trip today, which she saw it out well. It's her fourth run of the season and I don't think we'll go to the well too many more times this year. She likes the quick ground and we'll give the Breeders' Cup strong consideration - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

quotes.race: Sodexo Live! Princess Margaret Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: There were a few anxious moments when Simmering was short of room a couple of furlongs out, but she's won it nicely in the end. Ryan [Moore] said she was still a bit green coming through horses and thinks she'll improve again. He advised us to go up to seven furlongs next time - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

quotes.race: Albany Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Jamie [Spencer] said that Simmering has a lot of speed, he got off and he said you could think she's tailor-made for something like the Lowther. I suppose we just see how she comes out of it. She's by Too Darn Hot, I think she will stay seven, but she has got a lot of speed, so we shall see. There are some nice options anyway - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

runners.name: Swelter
runners.comment: Won only start at two, can be rated a serious contender following a 7g Group 3 success
runners.spotlight: Made a winning introduction over this trip at Leopardstown last July; did not appear again at two; had no trouble coping with the shorter trip when beating the experienced Exactly in a 7f Group 3 contest at Leopardstown eight weeks ago; leading chance for trainer who won this in 2022 and 2023.

quotes.race: Ballylinch Stud "Priory Belle" Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: I thought seven might be a little sharp for Swelter, it's probably the only time she'll be running over the trip. I see her as a 1m2f filly. She's a big filly and we gave her time to develop after her maiden win. She'll have learnt plenty from that, she goes for the Irish 1,000 Guineas - Dermot Weld, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Tamam Desert
runners.comment: Maiden winner, fifth of eight in a Group 3 race at Naas on reappearance, out of her depth
runners.spotlight: Won a Galway maiden over 7f last September on second start; 33-1 when fifth of eight in a middle-distance Group 3 race at Naas on reappearance; out of her depth.

runners.name: Anmaat
runners.comment: Eight wins from 13 races including both Group 1 runs, took a big scalp in Champion Stakes
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; winner of eight of his 13 races, including both Group 1 attempts, in the 2023 Prix d'Ispahan and a career-best when overcoming trouble in running to defeat Calandangan in the Champion Stakes; previously not seen to best effect in the Prix Dollar; runs well when fresh but has never faced a task like this on seasonal debut.

quotes.race: Qipco Champion Stakes (British Champions Middle Distance) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Anmaat is unbelievable. He's always gone under the radar. It was touch and go whether he'd run in this race, and we came here to finish third or fourth behind Economics and Calandagan. To go and do what he did, it's great. The first half went perfectly as I wanted to sit third or fourth and give myself an option, but I could see early on Los Angeles wasn't taking Ryan [Moore] on at all. When we turned into the straight I had horses on my outside keeping me in and we just had to try and work our way through. We just got completely stopped, there was no option b or c at the time. We were just stuck, but when he got the gap it was extraordinary the way he picked up - Jim Crowley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Betfred Rose Of Lancaster Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Anmaat had to be game, he just got a bit tired but he was entitled to after 439 days off. He needed a run last year to hit peak form so fingers crossed he comes out of this okay. He's in the Irish Champion but we'll let the dust settle after this and have a chat with Sheikha Hissa, Richard Hills and Angus Gold and go from there. It was a complex foot injury and all the team has done a great job to get him back - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix d'Ispahan (Group 1) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Anmaat is pretty laid back about life so he'll never win by a couple of lengths. He doesn't show a huge amount at home but he's bloody tough. The ground was as quick as we'd want to go in today but he doesn't half travel, even on this ground - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Gordon Richards Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It was a solid run. I thought we were up against it giving 5lb to Adayar and he's run his race. Anmaat needed to get his season started so I thought it was a good solid run. He battled away and it's tough out there, it's hard work. He's obviously in the Tattersalls Gold Cup in around three weeks' time and the Prix d'Ispahan in France, so we'll see how he comes out of this. We might try him over a little bit further at some stage. I don't know when but we'll see - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Rose Of Lancaster Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It was a big performance from Anmaat to win first time up at York and he had pleased me since. What surprised me was how far he travelled on the bridle, he's obviously really improving but we didn't expect that. We were stepping out of handicap company and I'm not sure where we'll go next, they'll be nice discussions to have. It was quick at York but interestingly Jim [Crowley] thought the bit of juice in the ground suited him - Owen Burrows, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has done nothing but progress all through his career, winning seven of his 12 starts with four seconds and a third. You don't get much more genuine than that and it has been a wonderful journey so far. Last year he started off on 103 in July but by the time he had wrapped up the campaign he had won three straight races including the Group 2 Prix Dollar on Arc weekend at Longchamp. He had a very good winter and I was keen to get a Group 1 under his belt, so we targeted the Prix d'Ispahan. He had a very pleasing return when second to Adayar while having to concede 5lb, which was no bad effort. It brought him to just where I wanted and we took the chance of going to France, where you know they can go very slow and then sprint. Thankfully he's very agile and has a great cruising speed and turn of foot. The ground was certainly faster by race time than it was advertised in the morning, but it didn't seem to be a problem, although I wouldn't want to run him on anything quicker. We spoke to Angus [Gold, Shadwell's racing manager] about Royal Ascot and the Prince of Wales's Stakes, but we thought it best to give him an extra couple of weeks after that and look at the Eclipse. Then he would have the obvious targets like the Juddmonte, Irish Champion and ultimately the Champion Stakes at Ascot in October. He put in a career-best performance last time and I don't think he has stopped improving yet. 07-06-23

runners.name: Continuous
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: St Leger winner in 2023 and fifth in the Arc, has never managed the same form since
runners.spotlight: St Leger winner in 2023, adding to Great Voltigeur victory; fifth in the Arc after his Doncaster win; has never managed the same form since, though he was an odds-on Group 3 winner over C&D last August; campaigned internationally over longer distances since in rear behind Anmaat in the Champion Stakes.

quotes.race: Longines Red Sea Turf Handicap (Group 2) (3yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Continuous ran very well. It was his first run back, so happy with him - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Shoda Market Cafe Royal Whip Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Continuous has loads of options. He could go to the Irish Champion Stakes or the Irish St Leger. He could run in the Irish Champion with a view to going to the Arc. He could go to the Japan Cup He is a very versatile horse and a great one to have. Dropping him back to this trip was not a worry. We decided we would take a lead today if we could. He could have popped out in front and done it all himself. He's a classy horse and an unusual type of horse and a very genuine horse. He can do it from 1m2f and possibly up to 2m - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Qatar Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Grande) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very happy. We made the decision to take our time and relax, and Continuous dropped in lovely. The pace was very slow so they sprinted in the last two or three furlongs. He was coming through, but obviously the winner quickened up on the outside. He's probably best over a strongly run mile and a half. He could go to Japan, Hong Kong, America or Dubai. All those things are open to him. He's a ready-made four-year-old and we think the best is yet to come - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: You would say looking at him at York, he was nailed on for this race and he had form on soft ground. Continuous didn't have any problem with the trip. He's got a lot of class, you could see it in his work every day. We're over the moon. The lads will think about the Arc, I'd say, he handles soft ground and gets a mile and a half very well and has class. He has all the things that could work in an Arc. It's just whether the two-week turnback is too tight or not. He has a great constitution as well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Continuous came here in the Dante and he needed the run badly and ran a massive race. I said to Ryan before the race would any of the other horses have run as well in Dante as he did and he said they wouldn't. A little bit of class usually outs, especially if the pace is even. We thought he handles an ease very well because he has a little bit of a round action but that was fast ground today and he didn't seem to have any problem with it. He bends his knee but obviously that's his best performance so you have to say he's very comfortable on it. I asked Ryan and he said he doesn't need a mile and six but you wouldn't rule him out - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV For Just 12 Euro A Month At racingtv.com Now Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Continuous is still a baby. He seems to stay well and he quickened up quite well. He's in the Beresford Stakes and that's a possibility for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the St Leger in 2023 and we've stepped him up in trip this year. He ran in the Dubai Gold Cup on Saturday but couldn't get into it from off the pace. 07-04-25

runners.name: Crypto Force
runners.comment: Lost form last year after 40-1 third of eight behind White Birch in this, up against it
runners.spotlight: Group 2 Beresford Stakes winner here in 2022 for Michael O'Callaghan; lost form last season after 40-1 third of eight behind White Birch and Auguste Rodin in this race, beaten 3l and 8l; well beaten in 1m2f Group 3 won by Galen here last month.

quotes.race: Alan Smurfit Memorial Beresford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Crypto Force is a very exciting horse for next year. Colin thinks he will be better on fast ground, he will have no trouble getting 1m2f but on quicker ground he will have just that bit more pace. Ideally it would be just nice to put him away and train him with next year in mind - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Waste And Recycling Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Crypto Force did it very well and he will have learned a lot today, he was quite green when he got there. Colin thinks he's very smart. The plan was to go to the Chesham if he was good enough to win one of these - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Deepone
runners.comment: 3-5 at two, including Group 2 Beresford Stakes here, ran only once last year, tough task
runners.spotlight: Was 3-5 in a 2023 juvenile campaign; highlighted by a course 1m Group 2 win Beresford Stakes; has raced just once since, well beaten in a Leopardstown Group 3 early last season.

quotes.race: Alan Smurfit Memorial Beresford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Deepone is a nice horse and a horse whose been progressive all year. Things just didn't go right for him last time at Leopardstown, but he came out of the race very well. He's a strong traveller and he finds plenty. I think he'll be a mile-and-a-quarter to a mile-and-a-half horse next year. I hope for his owner Vimal Khosla that he has a Derby horse for next year and that will be it for this year. We had dropped him in on turning tracks the last twice, but I said to Billy, no nonsense today. Let's go and see if he's good enough and he put them to the sword. I think he's a good horse - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Deepone was well in himself and we wanted to educate him today. He ran from the front today having come from further back last day. He would have been better with a lead today. Hopefully he's a nice horse and I think he will stay - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Deepone is a nice colt and was ready to start. I thought he would have to be good to win from his draw and it's great that he did - Paddy Twomey, trainer

runners.name: Ghostwriter
runners.comment: Unbeaten juvenile, solid form at the highest level last year, good run in Dubai in April
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten as juvenile, including the Royal Lodge; kept to Group 1 company last year, smart form including two Classic fourth places; third behind City Of Troy in the Coral-Eclipse and the International at York; 3/4l behind Los Angeles (fourth) when fifth in the Irish Champion; made a fine start to the campaign with fourth behind race-fit rivals in Dubai Turf.

quotes.race: Dubai Turf Sponsored By DP World (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was a good run. We were beaten by three hard and fit horses. Ghostwriter has grown up a lot. I could see him having a good campaign travelling because he enjoys quick ground. A mile and a half might be on the cards in time - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Jockey Club (Group 1) (3yo Colts & Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Ghostwriter had a great trip round and I'm really happy with how he travelled through the race. He probably just didn't find that change of gear that he has on quicker ground. I'm really pleased he's put up a positive performance and he's still a nice horse in the making - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Royal Lodge Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Ghostwriter is improving with every run and that was a big step to take. His dam won over a mile and a half and it's possible he will get that trip, too. He's always been a nice horse, but had a frame to fill as well. This cements what we thought. What next? We'll discuss it with Jeff Smith (owner) but I'd probably be thinking of next year. We've had a couple of foal entries for the Derby before but this is the first potential live chance who we could be thinking about going that way with - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: RoR horses For Courses British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ghostwriter is in the Royal Lodge and that'd be our plan. He's shown an ability to handle Newmarket, albeit on the July course, and we just love him. It's great to be having that dream and Plan A. We were really impressed with him first up. He's coped with his penalty well today and I loved the way he stretched away there. He's clearly going to get the mile well and he's progressed mentally, and physically he's getting better all the time - Clive Cox, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was so consistent last year and ran some mighty races, especially against City Of Troy in the Eclipse. This year I feel he's stronger and more physically developed, and I think he's matured so much and grown up mentally, so I'm really happy with him. We took him to Dubai for his first run of the season and he picked up Â£200,000 in prize-money for finishing fourth. He'd never encountered a journey like that and it was a joy to see him travel so well, which now opens up wider possibilities. He's come out of the trip really well and the Tattersalls Gold Cup could be a logical target. That'll mean going back up to a mile and a quarter and I'm hoping he can stay a bit further. I'm really happy with him and it should be an exciting year ahead. 17-04-25

runners.name: Los Angeles
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Irish Derby winner, third in the Arc, beat White Birch on return, not much between the two
runners.spotlight: Last year's Derby third and Irish Derby winner; top-class form at 1m2f when close up fourth in Irish Champion Stakes before fine third in the Arc; race possibly came too soon when flopped 13 days later back at 1m2f in Champion Stakes; stout display on return when mastering White Birch in the Mooresbridge, though the runner-up emerged with at least as much credit.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud City Of Troy Irish EBF Mooresbridge Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: The plan would be to come back here for the Tattersalls Gold Cup and, if that went well, Los Angeles would go to Ascot for the Prince of Wales's Stakes. Then we could have a look at the King George, give him a little break after that, and then have a prep for the Arc, maybe back here in the Royal Whip, before having another go at the Arc.  We're delighted with him. He's a lovely, big, honest horse. When he gets there he doesn't do much, but that's always been him. You can see he's still as big as a bull - he's big and powerful. It's very hard to get by him, because he's lazy and he'd be waiting there. We don't want to go too far with him until we have to. We want to keep him sharp for when he goes up to a mile and a half. If he goes to the King George, he'll want to be sharp - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I don't think Los Angeles needs to go any further. He probably will get further but he doesn't need to. He's done very little wrong in his career. He took me there easy but doesn't do a whole lot in front, but he's a good horse - Ryan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish Derby (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Los Angeles is progressing, definitely, and we're really looking forward to him. Obviously he's by Camelot so he has that class, so he can quicken. Ryan said he had a lot more class than he expected and he quickened very well when he got there. We came here thinking that he was going to turn into a Leger horse but Ryan said he has way more class than that - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Cashel Palace Hotel Derby Trial Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: He's a lazy horse at home so coming here today we went a nice even gallop and when I got stuck into Los Angeles he found plenty, I even thought the last half-furlong he was only doing what he had to. I think when he goes up in trip after that run I think he'll step forward a good bit - Wayne Lordan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Criterium de Saint-Cloud (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Christophe was very happy with Los Angeles. He's a very big horse and you'd imagine he's going to be much better next year. We felt the experience would do him good and Christophe said he picked up very well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Camas Park Stud Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: LOS ANGELES is a lovely horse and is going to come on an awful lot. It was a lovely introduction and he is going to be a lovely middle-distance horse for next year. Something like the Beresford or the 1m2f race at Saint-Cloud at the end of the year could suit. He's a horse to look forward to for next year. Whatever he does at two is a bonus - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

stable_tour.quote: We're very happy with him and the plan is to go for the Tattersalls Gold Cup. He might have a run in one of those mile-and-a-quarter races before. We feel going back to the Arc would suit him well - it didn't work out for him last year as he ended up making the running and he'd obviously prefer to be getting a lead, but he could be a very legitimate horse this year. He's big, powerful and has done very well physically. 07-04-25

runners.name: Royal Rhyme
runners.comment: Career-best when third behind Anmaat in Champion Stakes, promising return in Prix Ganay
runners.spotlight: Won the Brigadier Gerard Stakes on his return last year; generally found things too demanding at the highest level (sixth in the International, seventh of eight in the Irish Champion) before finishing with a career-best in taking third behind Anmaat in the Champion Stakes; made a satisfactory return in the Prix Ganay.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Doonside Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I always had tabs on the leader and I thought we went a nice gallop. I was just trying to get Royal Rhyme to relax and he was in great form and very professional. He won very nicely the last day at Goodwood and definitely deserves to be at this level. I felt like we were going a good gallop and he picked up and kept going off it and hit the line strong. The ground has dried up a little from yesterday and it's a bit tacky as well. This lad likes this sort of ground, so it's worked out well - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Kincsem Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Royal Rhyme is definitely a Listed class and possibly Group horse in the making. This is his kind of trip. He probably would get further if he learns to relax, but for now, definitely a mile and a quarter. He loves this type of ground - Clifford Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Howden Bloodstock Handicap
quotes.quote: When I rode Royal Rhyme at Kempton, early doors all he did was gallop away. The extra couple of furlongs though has done him justice. He travels well through that sort of ground and he's done it nicely now. I feel like he'll get a bit further as he's a very strong-travelling horse - Clifford Lee, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's done brilliantly through the winter and looks the complete article now. He was knocking on the door just behind the top horses in Group 1s last season and, if we could land on a Group 1 on soft or heavy ground, it wouldn't surprise me to see him finish with his head in front. 11-04-25

runners.name: White Birch
runners.comment: Sidelined after beating Auguste Rodin 12 months ago, very pleasing effort on his return
runners.spotlight: Third behind Auguste Rodin in 2023 Derby after Dante second; in rear in the Irish Derby and not at best at Leopardstown on final start at three; progressive in a hat-trick of Pattern wins at this venue early last season, culminating in an impressive victory over August Rodin in this event; setbacks later, returned with a fine effort against Los Angeles; every chance he can reverse the form.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Gold Cup (Group 1)
quotes.quote: White Birch has plenty of pace but would have no bother going a bit further. He has matured massively from three to four - Colin Keane, jockey

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Sottsass Irish EBF Mooresbridge Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We'll see how White Birch comes out of that and talk to the owners to make a plan. He has the option of the Tattersalls Gold Cup and also the Coronation Cup at Epsom. He's come on a nice bit from the last day and hopefully he can come on again - John Joseph Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote.ie Alleged Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: You'd always be worried about fitness on that sticky ground but White Birch did it lovely in the end. He behaved very well and we couldn't be happier with him. He travelled lovely throughout the race. He seems more mature now. He's in the Coronation Cup and the Tattersalls Gold Cup. We'll have a chat with the owners and see what they want to do. He's clearly good over a mile and a quarter but going back up to a mile and a half would be no issue either - George Murphy, assistant trainer to father John.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with White Birch and he stayed on really well. He just hesitated again at the gates and put himself into a difficult position but it was a great run. I'd say it will be the Irish Derby next, Colin gave him a great ride considering how it played out early on and he galloped all the way to the line, so all going well it'll probably be the Irish Derby next - George Murphy, son and assistant to John Joseph Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: P.W. McGrath Memorial Ballysax Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with that. We always thought White Birch could be a serious horse. His work had been super coming into today and he was obviously super impressive in his maiden at Dundalk. We're delighted he's done what we had hoped he could do and I think there could be quite a bit more to come as well. He has a big engine. We'll chat to the owners and make a plan from there. Today, with the pace he showed at Dundalk, we weren't 100 per cent sure he'd get the mile and a quarter but he's clearly got it very well. He's a lot of options and I don't think we'd be too worried going anywhere with him. He's very well balanced and moves very well, so I wouldn't be worried about going to Epsom anyway. I'm sure he'll have some big entries in the future - George Murphy, trainer's son and assistant.

runners.name: Kalpana
runners.comment: Huge progress last year, ending with victory in Group 1 Fillies & Mares on soft at Ascot
runners.spotlight: Handicap winner and Listed-placed before third in the Group 2 Ribblesdale at Royal Ascot; justified short-priced favouritism in a 1m3f Listed race at Hamilton and 1m4f Group 3 on AW at Kempton; took her form to a new level when defeating the Irish-trained Wingspan in Group 1 Fillies & Mares on soft ground at Ascot.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Fillies & Mares Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Kalpana is a wonderful filly and William Buick gave her a wonderful ride. This filly hadn't even done any fast work this time last year, so it's been a pretty steep trajectory from Wolverhampton to here. I've never known a horse improve as much. I even recall mentioning to Barry Mahon [Juddmonte racing manager] that we might put her in a sale this time last year but every time we started to do more with her, she's just improved and improved. She didn't love the ground today but she coped with it. She's such a diamond and has a very special temperament - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet September Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I still think Kalpana is a bit green and a bit raw. I think she's going to continue to improve with time and age. I'd be very excited about her and the sky's the limit - P J McDonald, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Glasgow Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't really know which way the race was going to pan out. I thought there might be a few of the lads battling for the lead and we had a plan to sit in and pick the pieces up but Kalpana jumped great and I got a lovely pitch the whole way round. Once I got into the dip and I sat into her in the rising ground she stretched and galloped to the line - P J McDonald, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Porta Fortuna
runners.owner: Medallion Racing 2020 Llc/S I Weston/Reeves Tbred/B Fowler

prev_owners.owner: B Fowler/Medallion Racing '20/S Weston/Reeves T'bred Racing
S I Weston/B Fowler/Medallion Racing 2020 LLC/Reeves Racing
B Fowler/Medallion Racing '20/S Weston/Reeves T'bred Racing

runners.comment: Four Group 1 wins incl' three over this trip last year; the one to beat if close to best
runners.spotlight: Group 1 winner over 6f at two; the best filly at a mile in Europe last year, winning three Group 1 races over the trip, Coronation, Falmouth and Matron Stakes; forgiven a below-par effort in the Breeders' Cup Mile when last seen; yard hasn't hit top form yet this year but she is the one to beat if close to her best on return.

quotes.race: Coolmore America "Justify" Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Porta Fortuna is an incredible filly, she shows up every day. It's a huge honour and pleasure to train her and I'm lucky to have her. We'll take her home and see how she is but all being well we'll be going to Del Mar (for the Breeders' Cup) - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Falmouth Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Porta Fortuna had been working well since Royal Ascot and everything went very smooth. We were very happy coming here although a short price favourite in a Group One race is always a bit of pressure. The Coronation looked like a strong race as all the best three-year-olds were there and it's nice to now see her go and prove herself against older horses. We will take her home and see she is healthy and happy before deciding where she goes next. Coming here today, we thought we'd probably give her a break before coming back for the Matron Stakes on Irish Champions Weekend in September. We could then look at going to the Sun Chariot before going to America (for the Breeders' Cup) - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Coronation Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Porta Fortuna is so uncomplicated, Tom gave her a lovely ride, I was happy the whole way and everything went to plan. It's not too often you can say that so I'm delighted. All along, she hasn't got the credit she deserves. She's never missed a beat, she had two runs before Royal Ascot last year and has literally never missed a race since. She's incredibly sound, incredibly tough. It's a testament to all the team at home. Anyone that has anything to do with her at home, I'm so proud of them and all the work they do. Newmarket is tough, there are a few ridges, they go a hard gallop and there are no hiding places. I think a mile is probably her maximum because she's got so much speed. On a turning track like this, Tom was able to sit on her and use that turn of foot that she has - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco 1000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Everything went right, everything went smoothly and the other horse just came past us late. I thought the French filly was the one to follow and I went after her but she's quick, she really took some pegging back. I felt Silvestre coming on my outside and he gave me a spurt for the last 100 yards but it wasn't quite enough. Porta Fortuna tried her heart out - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Cheveley Park Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We'll speak to everyone, all the owners, but the Breeders' Cup (Juvenile Fillies' Turf) was the long-term plan for Porta Fortuna and she's done nothing to turn us off that. I think she's very good, she was impressive in the Albany and this is the first time she's had proper quick ground since then. She looked the same as she did at Ascot, travelled strong, quickened and stayed very well. We'll see in America whether she gets a mile - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer, speaking on ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Keeneland Phoenix Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Porta Fortuna ran a cracker. She's Group-1 placed now and I'm delighted with her. I think she could step up to seven but staying at six wouldn't be a problem either. She was out there on her own today and had to do a little bit of donkey work. The Moyglare and the Cheveley Park are options for her. She could do both, we'll see how she comes out of it. We'll watch the Debutante next week too and see what she could be taking on in the Moyglare - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Albany Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We'll take Porta Fortuna home and see how she comes out of it. She is quite a scopey filly - she is owned by a bunch of American owners so the Breeders' Cup will be a target, whether she will stay that far or not we will see. We will see how she comes out of the race, then we will make a plan - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Azada
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Won a Naas Listed race over this trip on final start last year; a bit to find on return
runners.spotlight: Heavy ground 2yo maiden winner ran creditably on return last year in the Irish 1000 Guineas; won a Naas Listed race over this trip on final start last year; has a bit to find on return with most of these rivals.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Garnet Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Azada ran a very good race in the Irish 1,000 Guineas and won well as a two-year-old. The nine and a half furlongs might have been a little too far for her last time at Gowran. She'd been working well and I thought she might be hard to beat today. She's a very big filly and there's a possibility she may be kept in training next year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Azada travelled away and I thought if she showed here what she was showing at home that she would take a lot of beating. When I gave her a little kick she came alive. She is going to be a very nice filly next year - Leigh Roche, rider

runners.name: Birthe
runners.comment: Won a 1m2f Group 2 in France last year; below form in the Arc' when last seen; considered
runners.spotlight: Classy filly in France last year; won a 1m2f Group 2 in France last May and better form when second to the subsequent Group 1 winner Friendly Soul in another Group 2; forgiven a below form run in the Arc' when last seen; considered even though this trip looks a bit sharp.

stable_tour.quote: She was a Group 2 winner in France last year and has settled in well since joining us. She's a nice filly and will probably start off in the Ridgewood Pearl Stakes on Guineas weekend at the Curragh. 24-04-25

runners.name: Jancis
runners.comment: Won a 7f Group 3 last year; fine Listed run over almost 1m2f on return; this trip suits
runners.spotlight: Leopardstown 7f maiden winner on debut took the jump to Group 3 company in her stride at the same track next time; wasn't at her best behind Porta Fortuna in the Group 1 Matron Stakes afterwards; posted a fine Gowran Listed run over almost 1m2f on return this term; this trip will suit better so can be closely involved.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Brownstown Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Jancis is a lovely filly and a real athlete. We just took our time with her, we're happy with that, and we'll come back here for the Matron. She's a light-framed filly and I don't think we will do anything before that. I love the way she picked up when she went through the gears and Billy thinks there is more there - Willie McCreery, trainer.

runners.name: Naomi Lapaglia
runners.comment: Useful sort was beaten 2l by One Look in a C&D Group 3 on yard debut; needs to find more
runners.spotlight: Useful sort when trained in the UK but always came up short at Listed and Group 3 level; was beaten 2l by One Look in a C&D Group 3 on yard debut; needs to find more.

quotes.race: Bedford Lodge Hotel & Spa Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Naomi Lapaglia was a breeze-up filly and we spent a long time last year getting her right mentally. She needs to settle, and the problem at Goodwood last time was she was too lit up. We always thought a mile would suit her and the more racing she has the better she'll be. Hopefully she'll be able to step back into black type races, although we don't have a plan as to where - Richard Spencer, trainer.

runners.name: One Look
runners.comment: Won a C&D Group 3 on return and is worth her place in this grade; needs to find more
runners.spotlight: Two of her four wins have come at this track, notably the Goffs Million on 2yo debut and C&D Group 3 Park Express Stakes on 2025 return; is certainly worth her place in this grade but needs to find more.

quotes.race: Lodge Park Stud Irish EBF Park Express Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: She's tough and I think a mile is the minimum for now. Ten furlongs will be well within her compass. One Look will have an entry in the Lanwades Stakes. She's a Group winner now and we'll try and go as far up the ladder as we can. The ability was never in question it was just last spring she wasn't ready to do what the world expected her to do. She'll probably prove yet that she is that kind of filly - Paddy Twomey, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Race
quotes.quote: One Look did what we hoped she would do and it went to plan. I'm thrilled with the way she did it. That's her first piece of work this year. If she goes to Newmarket, she will probably go straight there - Paddy Twomey, trainer

quotes.race: Goffs Million
quotes.quote: One Look is a nice filly. I thought I would get her out earlier in the year, but it was just the way things worked out. She was just ready to run this week. I thought she was good enough to be competitive. The plan was to track Frankie (Dettori) on Cherry Blossom and see how we got on. I gave her a Guineas entry this week. It was a big performance to do that and I think that will be it for the year - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Rubies From Burma
runners.comment: Maiden winner last year was 3rd in a Kempton Listed on return; needs more up in class
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced; Cork maiden winner last year over this trip on third start was third in a Kempton Listed on return behind the smart Soprano; is likely still progressing but needs plenty more up in class.

runners.name: Veras Secret
runners.comment: Rapid improver ran away with a 7f Group 3 last time; stays this trip and is a  player
runners.spotlight: Huge filly was a late-starter but a rapid improver in handicaps last year, including winning over C&D; ran away with a 7f Group 3 at Leopardstown on return last time; stays this trip well and is a big player if this doesn't come too soon after such a big performance.

quotes.race: Al Shira'aa Racing "Mutamakina" Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Vera's Secret hasn't had a lot of racing and she's a big, strong six-year-old now. She's a quality filly and proved it today. This year, since she came back into training she's been training lovely and relaxing well. Nathan Crosse was to ride her today but he had to go to Hoppegarten for Willie McCreery. He's done a lot of work with her and she's his ride so we were lucky to get Seamie today. She's entered in the Lanwades on Guineas weekend and we'll probably come back for the Matron Stakes later in the year. She's a bit different this year, more mature and she'll come on for this as she's over 600 kilos and takes plenty of work at home - John Feane, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: Vera's Secret is a filly we like a lot. It's good that she did things properly today. She wasn't too keen. I think they all wanted to move to the middle and it suited her as she got a freebie and got to prick her ears - John Feane, trainer.

1:20.race_name: Tally Ho Stud Irish EBF Fillies Maiden

runners.name: Amerilis
runners.comment: Filly by Lope Y Fernandez, interesting prospect for an increasingly influential stable
runners.spotlight: 41,000gns F, E175,000 Y; eighth foal; half-sister to winners Heavenly Holly (Listed-placed 7f AW; RPR 98) and James Park Woods (7.5f/1m; 79); dam French 7f winner (81), half-sister to 1m2f Group 1 winner Lily of the Valley; interesting prospect for an increasingly influential stable.

runners.name: Balantina
runners.owner: Steven I Weston & Reeves Thoroughbred Racing
runners.comment: Betrayed inexperience when beaten favourite over C&D, winner runs in the Marble Hill
runners.spotlight: Betrayed inexperience when fourth (beaten favourite) over C&D; impressive winner is stepping up in class in the Marble Hill; can do better with the run under her belt.

runners.name: Beautify
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: A typically well-related daughter of Wootton Bassett, Ryan Moore favours over Composing
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to winners Library (7.5f 2yo/1m2f Listed; RPR 109) and Vice President (1m2f; 93); dam 7f 2yo/1m4f Group 3 winner (105), sister to 11.6f Listed winner Nevis, half-sister to 1m4f Group 3 winner/Derby second US Army Ranger.

runners.name: Cape Sounion
runners.comment: Showed definite promise when second on debut, winner Simply Astounding has since flopped
runners.spotlight: Showed definite promise when second on debut at Naas; winner Simply Astounding has since flopped when odds-on for a Group 3 event at the same venue; however, possibly wrong to read too much into that lapse.

runners.name: Composing
runners.comment: Cost E300,000 as a yearling, dam a Group 2 winner, Ryan Moore rides Beautify
runners.spotlight: E300,000 Y; first foal; dam 1m/9.4f winner (inc Group 2; RPR 112), half-sister to winners Dolce Strega (7f Group 3), Bumbasina (Listed-placed 1m) and Raffaello (7f/1m), out of unraced half-sister to Cesarewitch winner Darley Sun; Ryan Moore rides Beautify.

runners.name: Dancing Saxon
runners.comment: Half-sister to Group 2 winner Dancing Gemini, potentially interesting for top stable
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to 7f/1m winner Dancing Gemini (inc 2yo/Group 2; RPR 121); dam 1m AW 2yo winner (82); potentially interesting for top stable.

runners.name: Divine Blue
runners.comment: Half-sister to four winners, not one of the more likely candidates in a strong maiden
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-sister to four winners; dam unraced sister to 6f 2yo winner Chroussa, half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Carrizo Creek; not one of the more likely candidates in a strong maiden.

runners.name: Gia Mor
runners.comment: Cost E100,000 and is a half-sister to winners but appears to be stable's second string
runners.spotlight: E31,000 F, E100,000 Y; fourth foal; half-sister to winners Mathematician (1m2f/1m3f AW; RPR 84) and Marvellous Lady (9.4f AW; 61); dam runner-up 1m AW (inc 2yo; 76), half-sister to useful 5f-1m2f winner Alhaban; appears to be stable's second string.

runners.name: Hasita
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: From the family of Derby winner Harzand, may find a few of these rivals too quick
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to winners Hasna (10.3f; RPR 89) and Hasiyna (6f AW; 73); dam 1m AW winner (69), half-sister to 7f winner Hazmiyra, out of Group-placed 1m2f winning half-sister to Derby winner Harzand; may find a few of these rivals too quick.

runners.name: Mchenry Sunrise
runners.comment: Dam an unraced sister to several winners, others have stronger pedigree credentials
runners.spotlight: E60,000 Y; fourth foal; dam unraced sister to winners Iberia (useful 7f 2yo), World Famous (9.4f) and Perfect Light (8.4f/1m2f), out of 6f Group 3 winner.

runners.name: Paris Carver
runners.comment: $600,000 2yo, first foal, dam US stakes-placed 5f turf 2yo winner, could be well primed
runners.spotlight: $100,000 Y, $600,000 Ocala breeze-up purchase; first foal; dam US stakes-placed 5f turf 2yo winner, half-sister to US Graded stakes-placed 6f/6.5f winner McKale, out of unraced half-sister to US 7f/1m Grade 1 winner Affirmed Success; highly respected yard, could be well primed for this.

runners.name: Princess Sioux
runners.comment: Dam a half-sister to a winner in Italy, dam unplaced but quite well related, tough task
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to a winner in Italy; dam unplaced, closely related to 5f 2yo Listed winner Warsaw, half-sister to Japanese 6f 2yo Grade 3 winner Meiner Eternel.

runners.name: So Must I
runners.comment: Dam unplaced in France, out of 6f winning half-sister to Derby winner Ruler Of The World
runners.spotlight: Third foal; closely related to 1m AW winner Port Light (inc 2yo; RPR 101); dam unplaced in France, out of 6f 2yo winning half-sister to Derby winner Ruler Of The World.

runners.name: Taiyi
runners.comment: Slowly away on debut over 5f at Naas. extra furlong should help but hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Slowly away on debut over 5f at Naas; extra furlong should help but hard to fancy.

runners.name: Albert Einstein
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: Took first step towards justifying a tall home reputation with a polished display at Naas
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a Group-placed 5f AW winner from the family of Giant's Causeway; home reputation preceded him when coming through his first test at Naas in professional fashion, beating the once-raced second favourite readily, with a 12l gap back to the third.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Albert Einstein was never far away and that's the first time he's come off the bridle. We're delighted with him. You can see the size and power of him. He learned a bit today. Ger's horse had a very good run the first day. We always thought he was a Coventry horse. You'd like to get another run into him before it, though - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Andab
runners.comment: Made a strong impression on debut at Naas, this will reveal more about his potential
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior colt is a brother to Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf winner Victoria Road; notably easy to back when producing a smart debut performance over C&D early in the month; shooting clear inside the final furlong after travelling powerfully; slight concern that the market leaders failed to fire, with outsiders taking second and place; strong visual impression nonetheless.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Andab would come on plenty for the run, wasn't really expecting a performance like that. He jumped and travelled good, he picked up good when I went for him and got to the line well. He'll have no problem stepping up to seven and will get a mile in time. He took a while to pull up, which is always a good sign -Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: First Approach
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Showed the benefit of a Dundalk run when scoring at Naas, useful second string for stable
runners.spotlight: Beaten by a filly from the Murray/Aguiar team on debut at Dundalk; showed the benefit of that run when winning the 5f Naas event that served as a prelude to Little Big Bear's progression into a top-class juvenile for Ballydoyle in 20022.

runners.name: Power Blue
runners.comment: Debut winner over 5f here in March, third behind a smart filly at Naas, stable selected
runners.spotlight: Created a good impression when making all on debut here in March on soft; looked almost ready for an extra furlong at that stage and confirmed that impression on better ground when third in a 5f Listed race here three weeks ago; snug winner Lady Imam boosted the form with a fine display at Naas last Sunday; stable selected.

quotes.race: Castle Star At Capital Stud Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: It's a bit of a usual thing with Adrian [Murray] and his team winning this race! Power Blue was well prepared and he was the ultimate professional really. He showed a little bit of greenness but he really quickened up the last hundred yards and galloped out all the way to the boards so he'll be getting a bit further than five furlongs, that's for sure. Why not? [when asked whether he could emulate the achievements of previous recent winners of this race]. He won by a wider margin today than Arizona Blaze, who was a Breeders' Cup placed horse and Bucanero Fuerte probably won in similar fashion. He's a nice horse and there's sure to be plenty of improvement - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Miami Destination
runners.comment: Course 5f winner on debut, fair Naas run at a big price last Sunday, yard's second string
runners.spotlight: Winning favourite on debut over 5f at this venue; form was boosted by the runner-up Oh Cecilia at Cork; ignored in the market in a six-runner Group 3 event at Naas last Sunday, made the running to two out before fading into the fourth behind the exciting Lady Imam.

quotes.race: Shouldvebeenaring, New For 2025 At The Irish National Stud Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: We said to Wayne [Lordan, jockey] going out that Miami Destination would have no bother going six or seven furlongs , further down the road. Wayne said she needed a bit of company. She won well at the line. The ground wouldn't have been an issue for us and hopefully it's upwards and onwards now. We'll probably find a stakes race back here in May - Adrian Murray, trainer.

runners.name: Shes Too Kool
runners.comment: Unplaced dam is a sister to Group 2 winner Kool Kompany, thrown in at the deep end
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-sister to two winners on the continent; dam unplaced in seven starts, sister to Group 2 winner Kool Kompany;   thrown in at the deep end on debut.

runners.name: Stonezilian
runners.comment: Two uninspiring runs, including behind stablemate Miami Destination, makes no appeal
runners.spotlight: Last of six behind stablemate Miami Destination over 5f here on debut; struggled over a longer trip at Roscommon; blinkered now; outsider of stable's three runners.

runners.name: La Guapisima
runners.breeder: Mme I Corbani, A Mouknass Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Infinity Nine Horses, Gl Racing & Nicolas Saltiel

runners.comment: Listed winner and Group-placed as a 2yo in France; fairly handicapped; best form on soft
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner including in Listed company and Group-placed as a 2yo in France; she looks fairly handicapped on that form making her stable/seasonal debut having cost only 82,000euros; however, her best form is on soft ground.

runners.name: Murkala
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Off the mark when winning a 7f h'cap here last time; a hefty 14lb rise so needs more
runners.spotlight: Showed much-improved form to get off the mark when winning a 7f handicap here last time under a 7lb claimer; hit with a hefty 14lb rise so needs more but she is a progressive sort and gets another capable 7lb claimer today.

runners.name: Shiota
runners.comment: Hung right when winning a valuable Naas h'cap over this trip last time; raised 7lb
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f Naas conditions event last year and ran a fine race in a 7f nursery at this track final 2024 start; hung right when winning a valuable Naas handicap over this trip last time but was well on top; raised 7lb but should be very competitive.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Shiota is more of a three-year-old. She is growing like mad and I think seven is ideal for her. We ran her here to familiarise herself with Naas before the Ballyhane Stakes next month - Joe Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Varshini
runners.owner: Mrs Fitri Hay & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Won a 7f Gowran maiden on heavy last time; should stay 1m and a chance if handles ground
runners.spotlight: Some promise on her debut over 7f (good) at this track last summer; won a 7f Gowran maiden making her return on heavy last time; should stay 1m and has a sound chance on handicap debut if handles this ground as effectively.

runners.name: Calrissiana
runners.comment: Off the mark in a Naas maiden over this trip last time; up 3lb so has to progress again
runners.spotlight: Narrowly got off the mark on seventh start in a Naas maiden over this trip last time; up 3lb for that so has to progress again but she is a largely consistent sort and can go well.

runners.name: Empress Artemis
runners.comment: Both runs over this trip on AW; won a maiden and a similar effort in defeat; needs more
runners.spotlight: Both runs were over this trip on AW last winter for former yard; won a maiden on debut and put up a a similar effort in defeat since; needs more tackling turf for the first time on seasonal/handicap debut; 2lb out of the handicap.

runners.name: Fiona Maccoul
runners.comment: Won valuable EBF Final last year; 9l behind Murkala on return; 5lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Won the valuable EBF Auction Series Final over 7f at Naas last year; however, was 9l behind Murkala on return and is 5lb out of the handicap so has work to do.

runners.name: Gloriously Glam
runners.comment: Winner and placed several times as a 2yo; poor twice this term; 5lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Nursery winner and placed several times as a 2yo; however, has been poor twice this term and the various headgear worn previously is left off; 5lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Guinness Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Gloriously Glam got it easy in front which helps around here. She handled the ground well - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.name: Lady Lilac
runners.breeder: Robert Ryan, Brendan Quinn & Joan Quinn
runners.comment: Close 2nd in a Gowran maiden but not as good last time; 6lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Maiden has run well several times this year on AW and turf, all over 1m; was a close 2nd in a Gowran maiden two starts back but wasn't as good there last time; 6lb out of the handicap.

runners.name: Alphonse Le Grande
runners.comment: Won Cesarewitch at Newmarket last October; might need this seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Gained the last of his six wins when taking the 2m2f Cesarewitch at Newmarket when last seen in October; has won over shorter trips too but might need this seasonal debut; back with former trainer.

quotes.race: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It's unreal. I thought Alphonse Le Grande was second to be honest. He went to Chester and then won at Newcastle and we thought this looked like the right race for him - Cathy O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Brosna Town

prev_owners.owner: Timothy P Murphy & L J Young

runners.comment: Won a 1m4f Dundalk handicap in January; this first run since; prospects if staying trip
runners.spotlight: Won 1m4f Fairyhouse maiden last summer but was poor twice after; back to form when winning a Dundalk handicap over the same trip in January; this first run since; prospects if staying this trip.

runners.name: Arch Enemy
runners.comment: Up 4lb on Flat return but has been running over hurdles over the winter; considered
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort is a five-time winner on turf including the Leopardstown October handicap last year; up 4lb on Flat return but has been running over hurdles over the winter; considered.

quotes.race: Bay Leaf Handicap
quotes.quote: Arch Enemy was always running well but we were waiting for this day. She didn't get a hard race at Leopardstown so we came here today. She got away alright today and she got the breaks today - Patrick Magee, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Racing Yearbook 2022 Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Arch Enemy has had a few goes and has had some good runs, it has just taken time to get it together. I think she'll stay further - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

runners.name: Last Ammo
runners.comment: Beaten 8l in this race a year ago; debut for a new yard and the run might be needed
runners.spotlight: Sole turf win came in a 2m Galway handicap in 2023 off 6lb lower; last seen when beaten 8l in this race a year ago; debut for a new yard and the run might be needed.

runners.name: Naturally Nimble
runners.comment: 1m2f Navan maiden and Grade 3 juvenile hurdle winner; respected back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: One of two runners for yard; won a 1m2f Navan maiden when last seen on the level last September; Grade 3 juvenile hurdle winner since though was below form at Punchestown last time; respected back in this sphere.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Price Boosts Across All Channels" Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Naturally Nimble disappointed us a little last week so we thought that we would hunt around and see what happened. He did it well. They went a good gallop and the race fell apart in front of us and we were there to pick up the pieces. He stuck at it well and he enjoyed the nice ground. He ran at a high level on the Flat and hopefully he can keep improving - Richie Deegan, rider

quotes.race: Lynn Lodge Stud Maiden
quotes.quote: Naturally Nimble was entitled to do that. I always thought he was a nice horse and just took a while to come to hand - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

runners.name: Common Practice
runners.comment: Course winner has been in fine form chasing this spring; respected back on the level
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; useful dual-purpose sort scored sole Flat win over 1m4f at this track in 2022; mostly jumping since and won a Thurles Grade 3 novice chase in March before a fine Punchestown fourth; respected back on the level.

quotes.race: DNG Apprentice Derby
quotes.quote: Common Practice hit a little flat spot off the turn but he finished off well. We were a little bit worried about the trip coming here but he looked like he hit the line strongly - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran very well in the Lartigue Hurdle at Listowel but he then found it tough against the older horses over two and a half miles at Naas. He'll be aimed at some of those handicap hurdles during the winter. 27-11-23

runners.name: Granite Bay
runners.comment: In good form last year; further progress is feasible; may want more ease in the ground
runners.spotlight: Improved sort last year, winning three times including over this trip at Listowel final start; 4lb higher on return but further progress is feasible; may want more ease in the ground, though.

quotes.race: Jet, Peggy & Eamonn O'Carroll Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Granite Bay is a staying horse in the making although I didn't think it would happen this year. He is progressing with every run and we'll look for another race before the season ends - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Roscommon Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: We were a bit concerned about the ground, we were hoping for a few showers during the day and were debating about whether we'd run Granite Bay or not. Ronan said he'd be comfortable on good ground, but we just feel that he's a horse that would like to get his toe in. He is a bit big and immature yet - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: La Vita Nova
runners.comment: A 1m4f maiden winner last year; needs to be ready up in trip on return
runners.spotlight: Won a Limerick maiden over just short of 1m4f on second start last summer but was below that form at Leopardstown next time; needs to be ready up in trip on return.

quotes.race: Savoy Collection Median Auction Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: La Vita Nova loved the ground and was still a bit green when she hit the front. She's really stepped forward from her first run and is a lovely filly. I think those better races where they go along might suit her - Ronan Whelan, rider.

runners.name: Not Just Any Eagle
runners.comment: Up 3lb for win last time; disappointed sole run over this trip on soft; this suits better
runners.spotlight: Won his fifth race when taking a 1m4f Leopardstown handicap last time under this rider; raised 3lb for that; disappointed sole start over this trip on soft ground but this surface suits better; considered.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Lady Riders Handicap
quotes.quote: The race set up perfectly for Not Just Any Eagle. I bounced out to make it and I felt we were going quick enough down the back and let them go. He picked up well and was good and game the whole way up the straight. He's been a great servant to me and Pat. That's his fourth win in the past year - Robyn Donaghue-Leahy,  jockey

runners.name: Molly Hall
runners.owner: P R Dowling & Ms L R Dowling
runners.comment: Won a 1m5f Ballinrobe handicap last time; up 7lb and has an unhelpful draw so more needed
runners.spotlight: One of two runners for yard; won for the fifth time when taking a 1m5f Ballinrobe handicap last time; won over this trip on seasonal debut too; up 7lb and has an unhelpful draw so more needed again.

runners.name: Rock Of Ireland
runners.comment: 3.75l behind Not Just Any Eagle at Leopardstown last time; down 1lb; needs more up in trip
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; maiden posted similar efforts in three handicaps this term, including when 3.75l behind Not Just Any Eagle at Leopardstown last time; down 1lb; needs more up in trip.

runners.name: Robbies Rock
runners.comment: Useful hurdler; two solid Flat efforts lately; needs a bit more with cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: One win apiece over hurdles and on the Flat (this trip); runner-up in the Fred Winter Hurdle at Cheltenham and two solid Flat efforts lately; needs a bit more with cheekpieces added.

quotes.race: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered As Fred Winter) (Premier Hcap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Robbies Rock ran really well. He was flat out everywhere and had to take the brave man's route, but he stayed on really well and got to the line - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Robbies Rock is a very big, raw horse and hopefully there is a bit of improvement there. For a horse that has had a few runs, he's still fairly raw but he went to the line well - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Dark Oak
runners.comment: Consistent filly; beaten 5l at Cork last time but can get closer today down 3lb
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m4f Galway maiden last autumn and some fine efforts in defeat since, including over hurdles; beaten 5l at Cork last time but can get closer today down 3lb.

quotes.race: Sean Cleary Memorial Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Dark Oak has won a maiden now. We might go for a Flat handicap and then hurdling. She is very big and will be better in another year - Joe Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Sign From Above
runners.comment: Has won up to 2m; beaten 9l at Killarney last time and has to do more off 3lb lower
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner up to 2m has also won over hurdles; beaten 9l at Killarney last time and has to do more off 3lb lower.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boost All Channels Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sign From Above is a very consistent horse and never runs a bad race. He had two runs in Galway one day after the other and he ran a cracker both days. He'll be a nice horse there for nice handicaps - Peter Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Hop House 13 Handicap
quotes.quote: Sign From Above is a lovely horse and he's very consistent. He'll end up having a nice mark over hurdles and he's a great horse to have fun with - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Curious Bride

prev_owners.owner: Eoin Banville & K Bolger & Peter Robin Parkhill

runners.comment: Didn't get the clearest of runs but still beaten 14l at Killarney last time; needs more
runners.spotlight: Came back to form last year with two wins over approx' 2m; didn't get the clearest of runs but still beaten 14l at Killarney last time; improve from that but needs more.

quotes.race: Private Suites At Limerick Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Curious Bride stays well but Colin said she doesn't necessarily need to go that far. She had a going day today and we'll see what the handicapper does with her - Eamonn O'Connell, trainer

quotes.race: Play Ladbrokes 5-A-Side Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Curious Bride had the experience which stood to her and she got into a lovely rhythm. She jumped well and galloped all the way to the line. The further she goes the better - Sean Flanagan, rider.

runners.name: Miss Manzor
runners.comment: Pulled-up over fences when last seen and back on the level now for new yard
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France won over hurdles last year for Willie Mullins ad some good runs in defeat after; however, was pulled-up over fences when last seen and back on the level now for new yard.

quotes.race: Racing TV Club Day At Fairyhouse Hurdle
quotes.quote: Miss Manzor has a lovely attitude and she jumped brilliant, with the experience she had in France. She stays really well and was a simple ride - Paul Townend, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She looks big enough to jump a fence but will probably stay over hurdles for the time being as she's only four. 25-11-24

runners.name: Morse
runners.owner: Mrs John M Weld & N J Hitchins
runners.comment: Well beaten here last time and this ground will be lively enough
runners.spotlight: Sole Flat win came over 1m at Leopardstown on heavy ground last year but ran well up to 1m5f; well beaten here last time and this ground will be lively enough.

runners.name: Ozark Daze
runners.comment: Little luck in running over 1m4f at Roscommon six days ago and isn't ignored
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 14 runs but plenty of fine efforts in defeat; got little luck in running over 1m4f at Roscommon six days ago and isn't ignored though up in trip and class.

runners.name: Scatchwah
runners.comment: Disappointing over C&D last run of 2024; better on return at Dundalk;   more needed
runners.spotlight: Won over 12m4f on soft ground last year but disappointing over C&D last run of the season; better on return at Dundalk in April but more needed.

runners.name: Chutzpal
runners.comment: Won a 1m6f Killarney handicap when last seen on the Flat in July 2024;  considered
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort won a 1m6f Killarney handicap when last seen on the Flat in July 2024; two hurdle wins since; 11lb higher but has to be considered with yard in fine form.

runners.name: Pralognan
runners.comment: Needs to improve plenty on last two efforts; cheekpieces need to re-ignite the spark
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort is just 1-22 under all rules and needs to improve plenty on last two efforts; cheekpieces need to re-ignite the spark.

runners.name: The Mediator
runners.owner: Mrs Sheila Oryan/John F Doyle/Dee Lestrange/Grant Leon

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Sheila O'Ryan/John F Doyle/Dee L'Estrange/Grant Leon
Mrs C Walsh & J F Doyle & Dee L'Estrange & G Leon
Mrs C Walsh/Jf Doyle/D L'Estrange/G Leon
Mrs C Walsh & J F Doyle & Dee L'Estrange & G Leon

runners.comment: Ran well in defeat several times in maidens; last Flat run in Oct 2023; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Bumper and hurdle winner has run well in defeat several times in maidens; last Flat run in October 2023; others make more appeal.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Maiden Hurdle
