quotes.quote: The Mediator had been knocking on the door a long time. He has loads of ability but has been frustrating. We might stick him in a handicap - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Lisburn & Castlereagh City Council INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: The Mediator is a nice horse but still a big baby. He's one for next year really. He'll probably stick to bumpers this year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been so consistent and fully deserves to pick up a maiden hurdle somewhere soon. I think he can, too. 28-10-24

5:25.race_name: Glenroyal Hotel And Shoda Cafe Irish EBF Fillies Maiden

runners.name: Adrienne
runners.comment: Several fine runs; raced freely at Cork last time but a chance if settling better today
runners.spotlight: Consistent filly has run creditably in defeat several times in maidens and handicaps on turf and AW including over C&D; raced a bit freely in front at Cork last time but if settling better today should be involved

runners.name: Avant Nous
runners.breeder: S C E A Societe D'Entrainement Louis Baudron & Mme Amandine
runners.owner: Roderick Ryan & Trevor C Stewart & Stanley G Watson
runners.comment: Promise in a 7f Curragh maiden last year; this trip should suit, yard going well; player
runners.spotlight: Shaped with promise on debut in a 7f maiden at this track on sole start last year; that was a strong race, the winner ran away with the Lingfield Oaks Trial lately; this trip should suit on breeding, her yard is going well and she is one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Crystal Ball
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Two solid runs; cheekpieces worn last time are retained and she needs to find improvement
runners.spotlight: One of two runners for yard; well-bred filly ran similar races in maidens at Leopardstown over 1m and Gowran over just short of this trip; the cheekpieces worn last time are retained and she needs to find improvement.

runners.name: Ethereal Star
runners.comment: Well down the field in two maidens and handicaps will suit better in time
runners.spotlight: Well down the field in two maidens and handicaps will suit better in time.

runners.name: Gifted
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Well-bred filly from a top yard so has to be respected and market vibes can be a guide
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to 7f (2yo) and 11.7f (Listed) winner Espionage (RPR 112); dam 1m 2yo/1m4f Group 2 winner (108), half-sister to 1m4f and 14.5f (St Leger) Group 1 winner Simple Verse; well-bred filly from a top yard so has to be respected and market vibes can be a guide.

runners.name: Le Fleur Princess
runners.comment: Cost 1,500euros as a yearling; best watched unless market support
runners.spotlight: One of two runners for yard; second foal; dam well held 6f 2yo only start (RPR 40), sister to Irish 10.6f AW Listed/NZ 1m2f turf Group 3 winner Chance To Dance, from the family of 2,000 Guineas winner Rodrigo De Triano; cost 1,500euros as a yearling; best watched unless market support.

runners.name: Marzanda
runners.owner: Ronald Mcardle & Jack Gogarty & Ms Denise Mccourt
runners.comment: Beaten nearly 8l last time and has to find a fair bit of improvement on this better ground
runners.spotlight: Both runs at Gowran over 1m on ground with plenty of ease; beaten nearly 8l last time and has to find a fair bit of improvement on this better ground.

runners.name: Matrice
runners.comment: Was 2nd over 1m4f on sft/hvy at Limerick last time; handled the AW previously over 1m
runners.spotlight: The best of three maiden runs came over 1m4f in testing ground at Limerick last time; handled the AW previously over 1m so should be fine on this surface and distance; cheekpieces are added.

runners.name: Mittens
runners.comment: A fine debut run in a Naas maiden; should have improved since and looks a big player
runners.spotlight: A fine debut run in a Naas maiden over a touch further than this trip; the winner didn't advertise the form in a Listed race next time but this filly should have improved since and looks a big player.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly by Night Of Thunder. She was supposed to run at Cork a few weeks ago but the ground just got a bit too quick for her. She has entries in the Irish 1,000 Guineas and the German 1,000 Guineas and she's nice. We took her away to Navan to work a few weeks ago and she did it nicely. She has an entry at Naas on Monday and we're looking forward to getting her started. 23-04-25

runners.name: Nancee Spain
runners.comment: By a decent young sire and related to useful winners; hooded for debut; could run well
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; half-sister to winners Warnaq (1m-1m4f Flat inc Listed, RPR 100; 2m hurdle), Bear On The Loose (1m-10.3f inc Australia; 97) and Glaceon (1m; 69); dam 6f 2yo winner (79); by a decent young sire and related to useful winners; hooded for debut; could run well.

runners.name: Noli Timere
runners.comment: Was 2l in front of Crystal Ball last time; entitled to keep improving and is a big player
runners.spotlight: Was beaten 26l on debut in the Goffs Million on sole 2yo start; however, showed much more on return in a Leopardstown maiden over 1m when 2l in front of Crystal Ball; the winner didn't advertise the form since but this filly is entitled to keep improving and is a big player.

runners.name: Sharpen
runners.owner: Dj Stable Llc, Medallion, Weston, Hoffman
runners.comment: Ran green when beaten 18l in a Naas maiden on debut; enormous improvement required
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; ran green when beaten 18l in a Naas maiden on debut; that was on heavy ground so this surface can suit better but enormous improvement required.

2:58.race_name: Back A Winner - Birchwood Kia Chichester Handicap Hurdle
2:58.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Getaway Drumlee
runners.comment: Ran well both visits here; out of form last three runs; first tongue-tie; stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Ran well on both visits here, winning over hurdles last March and second over fences in December; however, he's been out of form elsewhere on his last three outings, back hurdling on last two, and now has tongue tied first time; not proven over this far; 10lb claimer is recruited.

quotes.race: yeeehaaa.bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Getaway Drumlee can be all right. He'll overcome a fence as well, but I'd imagine he'll go on through May and then we'll give him a break before we go chasing with him next season. He ran a blinder at Doncaster and better than I expected him to. It was great to see him follow up as he jumped and travelled beautifully, and it's nice to see Beau [Morgan, jockey] getting a couple of nice winners for us towards the end of the season. He had a couple of nasty problems - a fibrillating heart and a fractured fetlock - after Sandown when he last ran before this season, so he's had to overcome quite a bit. He's got a good attitude and it's brilliant to see his head back in front for his owners, who have shown so much patience with him - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We have a lot of lovely novices this season and among them is Getaway Drumlee. He joined us after winning his point-to-point at Tattersalls Farm in the spring and had been working so well I expected a big show from him on his rules debut over hurdles earlier this month and he did not disappoint. We started him off at Hereford over 2m3Â½f and although a little green he won very comfortably and can only have learned from the experience. I think he could be versatile regarding his trip as his point win came over 3m, yet I could see him being effective over 2m if asked. He is nice horse and although not too big he jumps well and has a lovely attitude. 26-10-22

runners.name: The Bold Thady
runners.comment: In-form runner who needs respect despite this being his shortest trip for over two years
runners.spotlight: Good-ground winner for claiming riders over 3m2f here last May and 2m7f last September; competitive on last three outings (good to soft latest) and needs respect despite this being his shortest trip for over two years.

quotes.race: Starsports.Bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Bold Thady in a battle uphill probably isn't the best recipe but it's great he put his head down and got the job done. He's a good solid, little horse - Neil Mulholland, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Sams Amour
runners.comment: Won this last year (good) by 21l off 19lb lower; also won twice in October when last seen
runners.spotlight: Won this race last year (good) by 21l off 19lb lower than today and she showed better form when 15l winner of a novice hurdle at Exeter (2m2f, good) in October; also took a 2m2f Stratford seller (good to soft) later in October when last seen; trainer won this race in 2022 as well; one to note.

runners.name: Doc Mccoy

prev_owners.owner: Ian Chanin, Tom Hooper, Peter Kingwell & Mark Booth

runners.comment: Third run this week and he's not proven over this far, but he easily made all on Thursday
runners.spotlight: Back to hurdles on last three outings with two 2m4f wins (Fakenham and Ffos Las) and a close second, all in small fields on good ground; this will be his third run in the last week and he's not proven over this far, but he easily made all off this mark in a conditional jockeys' race on Thursday and clearly has a leading chance if he remains in that form.

quotes.race: Adept GRP Cabinets Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Doc McCoy comes from a showjumping background, so she's very good over obstacles. I hope she can keep progressing - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame Doc McCoy didn't win his bumper, but he has always been a proper jumper. He is an embryonic chaser as he won a point-to-point at Great Trethew. He bowled along in front when he won his point-to-point so we thought we would let him bowl along and make it a test. We could aim him at the EBF Final at Sandown in March. That  is probably his kind of race as it suits proper staying chasers. That will probably be his target - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his hurdling debut before finishing fourth under a penalty, but he picked up an injury soon afterwards. He's back from a break and will go novice chasing. 06-11-24

Novice hurdling is the plan for him and he jumps well, while he performed to a good level in his bumpers, finishing in the places on all three starts. It was a shame he didn't win one, but Datsalrightgino didn't either. 28-09-23

runners.name: Up The Straight
runners.comment: 11yo; return to hurdling saw him well held over C&D one month ago
runners.spotlight: Useful over fences and hurdles in his prime; three races this spring represents his busiest spell for ages and he was second of four over fences at Exeter (3m, good) on second occasion, but return to hurdling saw him well held over C&D (despite similar form) one month ago.

quotes.race: Chris Young Memorial "National Hunt" EBF Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Up The Straight is a horse I was so excited about at home that I was afraid to say anything about it as generally they make a fool of you. But I think it's one of those races where one went flat out, a couple tried to go with him, and we've benefited from being ridden more quietly - Richard Rowe, trainer.

runners.name: Lelantos
runners.comment: Absent for 566 days; needs a market check but longer trips would seem to be ideal
runners.spotlight: Narrow winner off this mark at Newton Abbot (3m2f, good) in August 2023 but not seen since a poor show that November; needs a market check but longer trips would seem to be ideal.

stable_tour.quote: A consistent summer horse, he has been a credit to his connections, winning four times and being placed on nine occasions. We may try him again over fences, but he's not one for the depths of winter. 30-10-23

runners.name: Vorderman

runners.spotlight: Won a weak race here on hurdling debut in December; second under Ben Ffrench Davis at Plumpton (extended 2m4f, good) early last month in his first handicap but only four of five finished and he unseated early here on latest outing; early days but he probably needs some improvement.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed in a couple of points-to-points before getting his head in front at Charm Park in Yorkshire. He was second on his debut for us in a hunter chase but sustained an injury so has been off since, but I'm looking forward to having him back in our team this winter. He'll appreciate soft ground. 06-11-24

This winning pointer has a fabulous pedigree, being by Milan from the family of Simonsig, Dusart and Drumcliff. He came to us after winning his point at Charm Park by an easy 12 lengths. I wanted to give him a run before the summer break and he was second in a maiden hunter chase at Fakenham in the spring. For a horse who clearly needs a stiff track on softer ground, that was very encouraging on such a tight course. He'll start off novice hurdling and clearly has the ability to win races. 05-10-22

He got in a lovely rhythm round there and when one's come to him he's found a bit more so I was happy with that - Taylor Fisher, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

He showed a bit at Wincanton and dad was persistent because he knew the horse had ability, it was just about trying to find it - Fergus Gillard, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Follow @racingtv On Twitter Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Findthetime didn't behave himself at all at Sedgefield, he made a right fool of himself, so we thought we'd go again fairly quickly. He's got a special sort of earplugs in and they've done something to him, they've put him to sleep a little bit. He's always shown ability, he's won three hurdles. I think Nells Son needs a good break between races, to get him fresh. A lot of two-mile horses need to have a bit of bounce in them. I wouldn't give up on him, I still think there's a good handicap in him. He'll have a proper break and we'll get him back - Nicky Richards, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was progressive last season, winning his last three races at Sedgefield, Catterick and Wetherby, which saw his mark go up from 111 to 123. His last run was his best when he was particularly impressive. We had planned to run him at Aintree but he met with a slight injury, which put paid to those ideas. He's training very well now and hopefully will be ready to start off again in three or four weeks. We'll stick to hurdles until Christmas and then see whether we step him up to fences. 19-10-22

runners.name: Simple Star

quotes.race: AEJ Facilities Management Handicap Hurdle

He came back this season and ran a great race at Musselburgh and then I think it was trainer error putting him into tracks that started with a downhill and he just got too keen. Hopefully, he'll be back at Musselburgh at the end of the Flat season - Dianne Sayer, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Sussex Champion Chase Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

quotes.race: John Murtagh 60th Birthday Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matterhorn is going the right way very rapidly and we've got 12 months with him as a novice as well. His jumping is fantastic and that'll put him in good stead in the handicaps or novice chases. What we might do, subject to a discussion with Johnny [de la Hey, owner], is go for a 25,000GBP chase in August. We might then give him a break and try to pick up a nice early October novice chase if the ground is fast - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing To School Bridgwater College Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Matterhorn is a smart horse, sadly he struggles a fraction with his breathing. Hence flat track good ground is made for him. I think there's another race two weeks today in a National Hunt novices' hurdle he can run in with a 10lb penalty, and then I dare say we'll go chasing with him, because after December 1 he's not a novice any longer - Paul Nicholls, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: I haven't always had much time for summer jumping, but this year I kept a small team going at Highbridge, our second yard, and really enjoyed training them, tweaking their routine and doing a few things differently. We were rewarded with 20 winners, with Matterhorn the undoubted star. He has struggled all his life with his breathing, but bounced back from a third bout of corrective surgery at the start of the year and took instantly to chasing. Fences seem to help him breathe easier and he was on fire, winning four novice handicaps before a bad error at Newton Abbot halted the sequence; you can put a line through that. He returned at Ascot on Saturday where he was again below his best and was found to have bled, something he'd never done before. Having been on the go all summer he's now due a break and will be off until the spring. Needs two miles, a flat track and decent ground. 04-11-24

runners.spotlight: Only 1-12 over fences when with Willie Mullins but ran well (second off 2lb higher) in the 2024 Thyestes; not in anything like the same form since and sold for 16,000gns since last run; expectations may be reflected in the market signals.

quotes.race: Richard Brennan Fencing Services Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Glengouly jumps well at home and I think he can jump better than he did today but he got a good start and kept it up. When the mare came at him he picked up again which was nice to see - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Glengouly got a lovely ride from Jack. He got him settled going down the back and produced him nicely. I thought this trip might be a bit short for him. I love the way he jumped and he'll be prepared for the final of this series at Punchestown - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Ladies Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Glengouly was a bit idle in front, he was looking all around him. I wouldn't be afraid of going out in trip with him, he will go 2m6f or 3m next time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Bhaloo
runners.comment: Creditable third in Grade 2 handicap at Cheltenham last time; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Henderson runner whose record of 2-5 over fences features a Class 2 win at Newbury (2m4f, good) in March; creditable third in Grade 2 handicap at Cheltenham (2m5f) since, despite again tending to jump right; this in-form and comparatively unexposed 7yo commands respect.

quotes.race: Ascot Underwriting Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was good. A good start. I've never been convinced about bringing novices here the first time but Nico gave Bhaloo a wonderful, educational ride and by the time they got racing the horse's confidence was up. There's more to come and we love him - Nicky Henderson, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Visit Sri Lanka "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bhaloo was very professional and appreciated the better ground. This looks his trip. Nico De Bonville, winning jockey.

quotes.race: kcsofas.co.uk British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bhaloo was impressive. The 2m4f was ideal as 2m was a bit sharp last time - James Bowen, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We like him a lot - he's a really good-looking and promising young horse. He certainly showed he was going places last season, when he won novice hurdles at Doncaster and Kempton. I think we'll continue over hurdles for the time being. 22-10-24

runners.name: Real Stone
runners.comment: Most wins on soft ground; below form when returned to good going last time
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is stablemate of Heltenham; has gained most wins on soft ground, the latest in February; failed to show his form when belatedly returned to good going last time and chance may partly depend on what the weather does.

quotes.race: betting.betfair.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The race fell apart pretty dramatically, two of the others didn't run their race at all so you should take the form with a pinch of salt. But given our current form I'll take any win. There's nothing wrong, the horses just aren't absolutely ripping. We've probably got a few good days in Real Stone as he didn't do a lot of racing as a youngster. But under pressure he does go pretty violently left so that rules out Ascot and Kempton - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmaker Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Real Stone has been coming back from injury and has taken a while to get going. He wasn't a bad horse in his younger days, but it's taken him a while to get going again. Hopefully he can build on that - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Real Stone is a massive, unfurnished horse who we see as a chaser down the line. He has ability and the ingredients are all there, but we didn't expect him to do that first time up - Harry Skelton, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won a nice race at Haydock last season but injured himself when falling on his last start. We'll aim to start him back at Haydock on November 23, because the track really suits him. Soft ground is what he wants and when he gets the conditions he needs he'll be productive. I'd like to think he could win a race or two this term. 12-11-24

runners.name: Vintage Fizz
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing & T S Ingham
runners.comment: Form of his last three attempts at about 2m4f is respectable; one to consider
runners.spotlight: No win since September 2023 but the form of his last three attempts at about 2m4f is respectable, creditable third in Class 2 at Ayr the final time; non-stayer over 3m in the Staffordshire Plate here most recently; one to consider, back down in distance.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Topham Chase in the spring and this race again next year would be Vintage Fizz's targets if he gets his ground again. The Becher Chase would be too far for him so he'll have his holiday now and come back in the spring - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

3:13.race_name: QuinnBet Daily Free Bet Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
3:13.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 5.6, Hurdle 5.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Service Minimum
runners.comment: Easy win at Ludlow on hurdles debut; major player, provided she stays this new trip
runners.spotlight: Solid 2m record comprises placed efforts in bumpers and an easy win over hurdles at Ludlow (straightforward task); major contender under a penalty, provided she stays this new trip.

stable_tour.quote: She ran well at Uttoxeter first time and should improve from that in bumpers, but she's definitely a jumper down the line. 12-11-24

runners.name: Brooklyn Callin
runners.comment: Rules form is far from convincing; yard also runs Fresh As A Daisy
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner whose rules form is far from convincing; yard has a stronger chance with Fresh As A Daisy.

runners.name: Fresh As A Daisy
runners.breeder: N J Henderson And Mrs S A Aston
runners.comment: Has shown ability in bumpers; dam and granddam won over hurdles for this stable
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability in bumpers, finishing fifth at Huntingdon (Listed) then second at Wincanton; dam and granddam were successful over hurdles for this stable; respected with progress likely.

stable_tour.quote: Along with the Astons, I bred her and - in keeping with her family - she showed the right signals last season, but never made it to the track. We'll likely start in a bumper, but she could go a long way as a novice hurdler. 30-10-23

runners.name: Just Tell Robyn
runners.comment: Poor claims on form
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced mare who has poor claims on form.

runners.name: Tennessee Orange
runners.comment: Form figures of 64231 in points; has joined major yard for rules career
runners.spotlight: Produced form figures of 64231 in points; difficult to assess accurately but has joined a major yard for rules career; the betting may offer further guidance.

runners.name: Crystal Spring
runners.owner: J Hankinson, P Hanson, R Pipe And T Pipe
runners.comment: From a good family; clear second at Fakenham on hurdles debut; may progress
runners.spotlight: From a good family; placed in one of her bumper starts; clear second at Fakenham (2m4f) on the switch to hurdles and may build on that effort; one of the main contenders on form.

4:23.race_name: Steve Budding 60th Year Celebration Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Art Of Diplomacy

prev_owners.owner: Imperial Racing, J Blackburn & P Scott

runners.comment: 0-6 over fences but has largely consistent form and this step back up to 3m is a plus
runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdles winner; 0-6 over fences but has largely consistent form in this sphere and seemed to find the drop back to 2m3f against him last time; possibilities returned to 3m.

runners.name: Masterdream
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Julien & A Tamagni-Bodmer
runners.comment: Exited in the early stages last time, taking chase record to 45U; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Made a bad mistake and exited in the early stages last time, taking chase form figures to 45U; not especially solid and remains 3lb above last winning hurdles mark; others preferred.

runners.name: Leading Force

prev_owners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood

runners.comment: Went close over hurdles at Southwell five days ago on stable debut; point/chase winner
runners.spotlight: Hung left but went close over hurdles at Southwell (3m, good) five days ago on debut for new stable, pulling clear of the third; now goes in reapplied cheekpieces, which should be beneficial; cracking chance off same mark, especially having gained his wins over fences (point/rules).

stable_tour.quote: I think there's plenty more to come from him. I know we've had him for a while but we're still working out his best trip. After his run over 2m4f at Newcastle last week, it's clear he needs further. We've had his wind done and he ran a really nice race on his comeback. He'll go over 3m next time and he also needs good ground, so we'll have to find the right race for him. 22-01-25

runners.name: Sweet Street
runners.comment: Clear best form for current yard when winning off this mark at Worcester last July
runners.spotlight: One standout performance for current yard, namely Worcester win off this mark last July; nicely weighted but needs a physical tweak (wind surgery since last run) to facilitate a revival.

quotes.race: BetVictor Irish EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sweet Street is an honest homebred owned by my father-in-law (John Motherway). She's probably improving a little every day. It was a pity that she didn't get black type last time but we might have another shot at it somewhere. She's versatile in terms of ground but I'd say she needs a trip, that seems to be her secret. Hopefully we'll have more fun with her. She has the option of going to Down Royal for a Grade 3 mares' novice hurdle or coming back here against the geldings in a fortnight. We'll see closer to the time - Roger McGrath, trainer

quotes.race: Wexford Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sweet Street deserved that. She's very honest and consistent. We'll probably stay over hurdles and go chasing next year - Roger McGrath, trainer.

2:38.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 5.6, Hurdle 5.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Fine Casting
runners.comment: Not disgraced last time; capable of being involved but losing run is mounting up
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in higher grade at Newbury last time and is capable of being involved off current mark; however, losing run is mounting up.

quotes.race: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fine Casting ran a cracker last time at Doncaster on ground that was probably too quick for him. [It was] a good gallop on that ground as well today and he was on the right mark. He had the earplugs in today and was a bit asleep on me, but he came alive in the back straight - Kevin Brogan, winning rider.

quotes.race: Play 3-2-Win At MansionBet Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm very pleased with that. I think Fine Casting is very good and he'd be a horse for the Aintree bumper. He's probably a two-and-a-half miler who wants a proper gallop but the better bumpers are run at better paces - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a couple of seasons over hurdles and was fourth in the Imperial Cup last season, but he could be miles better as a chaser - we schooled him over fences recently and he was electric. He loves soft ground. 10-11-23

We've always thought a lot of him and he won his bumper last season at Newbury in good style. He has run twice over hurdles this season, most recently at Uttoxeter where he jumped much better. He still needs to learn to relax but will win his novice soon and how far he will progress I do not know. I'd be disappointed if he did not turn out to be a decent handicap hurdler. 30-11-21

runners.name: Gwash
runners.comment: Interesting on two pieces of form last spring but has been absent for ten months
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; interesting on two pieces of form last spring but has been absent for ten months; the betting may offer further guidance.

runners.name: Kaituna River
runners.comment: Couple of sound efforts since wearing cheekpieces and returned to hurdles; solid
runners.spotlight: Couple of sound efforts since wearing cheekpieces and returned to hurdles, taking record in this sphere to 631322; solid contender in the retained headgear.

runners.name: Marlacoo
runners.comment: Solid operator whose overall form figures read 132F213; firmly in the mix
runners.spotlight: Solid operator whose overall form figures read 132F213; started favourite the last four times; ran creditably off this mark at Fontwell (2m5f) most recently; firmly in the mix.

runners.name: Miss Maverick
runners.comment: Game win at Hexham this month; won on this card last year, completing a Uttoxeter treble
runners.spotlight: Bounced back to form with game win at Hexham (2m4f) this month, taking hurdles record to 4-9; scored on this card last year, completing a Uttoxeter hat-trick; strongly respected.

quotes.race: TCS Recruitment Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Miss Maverick just handled the ground better than the majority in this race. She's a keen-running sort and, to be honest, I didn't have a lot left in the tank but she had the race won from a long way out and hopefully she can progress from this - James Davies, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Grey Skies
runners.comment: On a two-year losing spell; return to hurdles had little effect last time
runners.spotlight: On a two-year losing spell and the belated return to hurdles (from fences) had little effect last time; others preferred.

4:58.race_name: Happy Birthday Mark Sergeant Handicap Hurdle
4:58.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: Chase 5.6, Hurdle 5.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Vocito
runners.comment: Record of 4-8 (hurdles/fences) for this yard; disappointing last time but not written off
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-8 (over hurdles/fences) since joining current yard; disappointing favourite at Perth last time, when bidding for a chase double on return from break, but can't be written off.

quotes.race: Exim Routes Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Vocito has been a durable little horse and his owners have been with me a long time, so it's great. I thought there were horses in there with potential and he was having to give them so much weight, but he had a softish lead up front and that bit of experience counted for a lot - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: PJ Nicholls KGM Korea Genuinely Made Novices' Hurdle (Arc Summer Nov' Brush Hdl Series Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Vocito was quite a cheap horse and he's improved each time for Olly. Today was probably the first time he's really switched off and wasn't running tense and actually breathing properly, and I think that's what brought on the improvement - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: GAIN The Advantage Series Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up in trip helped a little bit. Vocito has been knocking on the door, running well without collecting and deserves to get his head in front - Kevin Manning, jockey.

runners.name: My Friend Sean
runners.comment: Improving hurdler; 4-6 since wearing cheekpieces and 3-4 under Cameron Iles; 2-2 over C&D
runners.spotlight: Improving hurdler; won going away at Plumpton (2m1f, good) most recently, taking strike-rate since wearing cheekpieces to 4-6 and record since being ridden by Cameron Iles to 3-4; he's 2-2 over C&D; respected.

quotes.race: Harry & Betty Savill Memorial Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My Friend Sean has been brilliant this season. It's taken him a long time to get into this rhythm of winning, there's just been a load of maturity and he's gotten a lot better with time. I was wide on the home turn but that didn't bother me too much, it gave me a bit of space and he ran a cracker. He travelled and jumped and did everything right. We don't know his ceiling, as we didn't think he was well-handicapped six months ago but he's won four times since  - Cameron Iles, rider.

runners.name: Model Approach
runners.comment: Scored twice in the autumn; well below par in last three starts (hurdles/Flat)
runners.spotlight: Faller in Listed grade when bidding for an autumn hat-trick in juvenile hurdles; long way below par in three subsequent starts (hurdles/Flat); others preferred on current form.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Today Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr [Jim] Bolger told me he'd win the Triumph Hurdle after I bought him. He could go for something at Cheltenham in November - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.comment: Form figures of 1321F2 over hurdles for this stable; clear second at Warwick four days ago
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 1321F2 over hurdles for current stable, most recently clear of the remainder at Warwick (2m, good) four days ago; strong chance turned out off same mark before he's reassessed.

quotes.race: Veolia Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Tara Iti is bred to go on this testing ground. He travelled well despite being a little keen early. I took it up early enough, but he kept it up all the way to the line - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: School Days Over

runners.spotlight: Bumper/chase winner but 0-10 over hurdles for Fergal O'Brien; sold for 8,000gns since last run; drops in class off a workable mark based on best form.

runners.comment: Market drifter and failed to show improvement on handicap debut last time

runners.spotlight: Maiden whose November/December efforts suggested his turn was near; below-par favourite the last twice (made a respiratory noise latest) but could well rebound, having had wind surgery since; now goes in tongue-tie; not written off.

runners.comment: Has shown positive signs this spring, finishing second twice; respected
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has shown positive signs this spring, finishing second twice; the way he shaped at Ffos Las (2m4f) last time suggests this new trip is worth exploring; pedigree backs up that impression; respected.

runners.name: East Eagle

runners.comment: Had wind surgery prior to opening his account in Southwell contest last month
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery prior to opening his account in Southwell contest (3m) last month; may build on that win and finally show the consistency he has lacked previously over hurdles.

runners.name: Pooleys Promise
runners.comment: Belied her odds (28-1 rank outsider) with success at Ffos Las this month
runners.spotlight: Belied her odds (28-1 rank outsider) in 3m event at Ffos Last this month, getting off the mark; hard to dismiss, being a last-time winner, but it remains to be seen whether she backs up that apparent improvement.

runners.spotlight: Half-brother to his yard's 2m chase winner Thatza Dazzler; promising third of eight at Wincanton (good) where he fared best of the newcomers despite hanging; the only runner who has the benefit of experience.

runners.name: Bushstreet Bowman
runners.comment: Represents major stable but doesn't stand out on pedigree
runners.spotlight: Represents major stable but doesn't stand out on pedigree, being by Schiaparelli out of unraced sister to a point winner; the betting should give further guidance.

runners.name: Fine Fellow

runners.spotlight: Dam triple point winner, out of half-sister to hurdle/chase winner Deciding Moment, is granddaughter of unraced half-sister to some smart sorts, including bumper performer Inca; yard is 12-104 in bumpers.

runners.name: Man Up Front
runners.comment: Not persuasive on breeding and stable is 0-17 in bumpers in last five seasons
runners.spotlight: Dam point winner, half-sister to 2m4f-3m1f chase scorer Good Order, out of 2m chase winner; stable is 0-17 in bumpers in last five seasons; not an obvious type.

runners.name: Suspected

runners.spotlight: 20,000euros 3yo; half-brother to bumper/hurdle winner Parade Away; dam 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase scorer, sister to bumper/hurdle winner She's On The Case; suitably bred but yard's bumper strike-rate is modest.

runners.name: Alba Crus

runners.spotlight: 22,000euros foal, 55,000euros 3yo; half-brother to five winners, notably Kolossal (European 1m2f-1m4f including Group 3; RPR 110); James Bowen is a positive booking; warrants respect.

runners.name: Whin Cover
runners.comment: Half-brother to hurdle and point winners; stable is 1-12 in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 2m4f hurdle scorer Pop The Question and two point winners; dam multiple point winner, also placed 2m7f/3m hunter chases, out of 6f scorer; stable is 1-12 in bumpers.

runners.name: Kaydence
runners.breeder: R D And Mrs J S Chugg

runners.spotlight: Â£26,000 3yo; dam point/3m chase winner, half-sister to bumper/hurdle/chase winner Finney and useful bumper winner Our Matti; one of two suitably bred newcomers for this yard; shortlisted.

runners.name: Strong View
runners.comment: Half-sister to three winners, notably bumper winner and smart hurdler Strong Leader
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to three winners, including two for her connections, notably Strong Leader (bumper and smart 2m-3m hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to Hennessy Gold Cup winner Strong Flow; leaps off the page.

runners.name: Candelari
runners.breeder: Haras De Son Altesse L'Aga Khan Scea

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan

quotes.race: Dubai Gold Cup Sponsored By Al Tayer Motors (Group 2) (Turf)
quotes.quote: That was great. Dubai Future is a very talented horse. My concern was the trip. He's a strong traveller but he relaxed today, he switched off. They didn't go a strong pace early on but he relaxed for me. When I let him down I let him organise himself before I really went for him and he responded to pressure. It was a great performance by Saeed - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

quotes.race: Nad Al Sheba Trophy Presented By DP World (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Future had a little bit of a setback last year which is why he didn't run. I didn't want to lead with him today as it was his first time back after a break, so I told him [de Sousa] to go in behind. He'll now go straight to the Dubai Gold Cup - Saeed bin Suroor, trainer.

quotes.race: Bahrain International Trophy (Group 3) (3yo+) (Outer Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We've tried to win this race in the last few years with no luck, but this year we had two runners and had first and second. Dubai Future has improved a lot this year and he won at Royal Ascot. Physically and mentally, he was better than last year and we thought he was the right horse again for this race - Saeed bin Suroor, trainer.

quotes.race: Wolferton Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dubai Future did well. Danny's given him a very good ride. He's a jockey I like a lot, he gives the horse a chance and we've had some good luck with him. I said to keep a hold of him and keep him relaxed in the race, which he did. He tried and he finished the race well, and he'll go for the Princess of Wales's Stakes at Newmarket next. I love it here, I love being in the winner's enclosure - but it's so hard to get winners here. It means a lot for the family to get winners and to do so with Fazza and Hissa here too - Saeed Bin Suroor, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Racing Club Classic Presented By The View at the Palm (Listed Rated Conditions) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Everything went pretty smoothly although Dubai Future was a bit keen early on. I had a lovely spin around and when the gap opened he shot through it and we probably ended up in front a bit sooner than ideal. That said he galloped all the way to the line and I would like to think he can build on this up in class - Pat Cosgrave, jockey.

quotes.race: Matchbook Best Value Exchange Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Dubai Future has done that really, really well, couldn't have been any easier. I would have liked to have waited a little longer turning for home but as soon as the gap came he was very willing and he just took me straight through it. He's a proper horse. I'm not sure about the plan now. I suppose there's a chance he could go to Dubai, he's proven himself quite capable now but that's not my decision to make - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He provided our first carnival winner this season in the Listed Dubai Racing Club Classic last week - a race he finished second in last year - and thrives here in the winter. After the impressive manner in which he won last week, there are possible races for him over 1m6f in the Listed Al Khail Trophy on Friday or the Group 3 Nad Al Sheba Trophy on February 17, before going back to 1m4f for the Group 2 Dubai City of Gold on Super Saturday. 26-01-22

quotes.race: Davies Insurance Services Gala Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Passion And Glory was down in trip and Saeed thought the ground might be a bit quick, but he handled it fine. It's maybe on the quick side of good and he jumped well and travelled well, so I let him use himself with this being his minimum trip. I didn't know where he was fitness-wise, but he hit the line well enough and had a good blow after. I did think something could tap him for toe, so that's why I took him on early enough before I got headed. I was a bit worried I committed too soon, not knowing his fitness levels, but he got away with it today - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: l'Ormarins Queen's Plate Glorious Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: That's the best sort of ground for Passion And Glory and he handled it really well. I'm now thinking of taking him to Germany for the Group 1 at Baden-Baden. I've always liked the horse but tiny problems have kept stopping him - Saeed Bin Suroor, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good season in Britain last year, winning three consecutive races before finishing third in Group 1 company in Germany behind subsequent Arc winner Torquator Tasso. He had his first start of this year on January 14 in the Listed Dubai Racing Club Classic over 1m4f, will have improved for the race and will have various entries from 1m1f to 1m4f in Dubai. A trip to Saudi could also be a possibility for the Red Sea Turf Handicap, for which he's received an invitation. 26-01-22

quotes.race: Prix Vicomtesse Vigier (Group 2) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We're dreaming of the Arc. If he runs well in the Grand Prix de Saint-Cloud, and then if you got a wet track and there was a situation where there was no great three-year-old coming through, we'd certainly be giving the Arc some consideration. Especially on what we saw today, with Double Major putting a lot of pressure on from the 800 [metre mark], Sevenna's Knight was still able to sprint off that, so it's a very encouraging sign that he's going to come back in trip and do well. He doesn't need deep ground and in Dubai he ran well on a faster surface, but I think in an Arc it would give him a bit of an edge. Andre is such a master of making the right decision. I would think that's the first option, but if we don't run well at Saint-Cloud and coming back in distance doesn't work, we'll give Melbourne a thought. I think the trip to Dubai always helps these horses mentally ? that's been a real plus. Even though we went there not really as a winning chance. I think that was good preparation for what's happening with this horse now - Terry Henderson, owner's representative.

runners.name: Presage Nocturne
runners.owner: Paolo Zambelli, Carlo Pellegatti Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mme Rana Khaddam, Carlo Pellegatti Et Al

quotes.race: Prix de Barbeville (Group 3) (4yo+) (Moyenne Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was quite confident beforehand because Presage Nocturne seemed so well, but they only hacked and, although he can sprint, it wasn't ideal for him. We have several options now, and he could go to America or else target the new Group 1 here [the Prix Vicomtesse Vigier]. He has never stopped improving - Alessandro Botti, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Royal - Oak (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Trueshan has never done France back-to-back before. He hasn't won a Group 1 this year unfortunately, but he's been so consistent, maybe the most consistent he's been at any stage in his career. Second in the Cadran, and a few weeks before that [he was] second in the Doncaster Cup, and he ran well on quick ground at Goodwood. He's still enjoying his racing and he always pulls up fine, which is what you want from an old boy - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trueshan ran a solid race. He lost a shoe which didn't help. It was quicker than ideal, but I felt that we just needed to try. Hopefully, we'll get some softer ground in the autumn. He's not the same horse on this ground as he doesn't let himself go. If he kept doing it, he probably could do some damage. Hopefully, we've gotten away with it today. He just doesn't quicken off this ground. He's in the Lonsdale and Doncaster Cup, but we'll see. He'll go where the ground takes him. The Prix du Cadran is the big target - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Marathon (Listed Race) (Registered As The Esher Stakes)
quotes.quote: I expected Quickthorn to go on, but Tom [Marquand] took a sit on him as we went a generous pace. Trueshan probably relaxed better than ever, which has been the theme this year. I let him roll a bit earlier than ideal, but he hit the line hard and it's a good platform going forward - Hollie Doyle, rider.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Cadran (Group 1) (4yo+) (New & Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Trueshan was quite exuberant last time so I just thought I'd take the bull by the horns and ride how I wanted to ride him. He loved it in front, he pricked his ears and we went a nice tempo. I'm not going to lie, I was quite worried walking the track this morning whether it had dried out a bit too much for him but he's a class horse - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trueshan is just superior, he's back to his best. To do it that way round was a pretty extraordinary performance. He can settle beautifully if he can use himself. But we were going a pedestrian pace and when you're breaking a big horse's stride like that it's never going to end well. So I just let him bowl along and it was a make or break moment really - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Barry Hills Further Flight Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I'm very disappointed. Hollie thought Trueshan would win three furlongs out but knew he was beaten two furlongs out. He's had a lot of very hard battles and it's just a worry about whether it's left its mark on him mentally but we'll know more after his next race. He'll have to take a step forward from that. He'd worked awfully well at home before coming here. We don't weigh them and we had to go for an extra long girth to get around him today - he looked big and powerful. He was having a nice blow rather than an excessive one afterwards and I'm not going to use that as an excuse. The next race will tell us a lot - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We'd been pretty happy with Trueshan in the last couple of weeks. The ground was right today. The second horse kept battling. He wasn't stopping and he kept coming back at us, so he had to be right up there to hold him off - Alan King, trainer, speaking on ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trueshan was remembering Goodwood. He was frightened to let himself down today, the ground is perfect but he's gone right, he's gone left. It was only in the last furlong that Hollie said he's let himself go. He had a very hard race at Newcastle then we ran him on ground that was quicker than he wants at Goodwood. I think it's left its mark. People have criticised me all the way through about the ground and taking him out but I think you can see why. I've got to speak to the owners but I'd say it's Ascot or nowhere, I'm not going to get him back in two and a half weeks. I hope we get really soft ground, otherwise I might put him away for the winter - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: That's as good a Goodwood Cup as we've seen for a long time. It was a hell of a performance. It was a proper Goodwood Cup and I think it's fair to say Trueshan is very good, but not at his absolute best on that ground. I was happy to run him and I've no regrets about running him, but we know he's better on soft ground - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Northumberland Plate Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It was an extraordinary win. Hollie told us exactly how she was going to ride Trueshan and she did it. We just tell her to get on with it and she does it. It's well documented we were running because we couldn't run at Ascot, we are aiming for the Goodwood Cup and we needed a run. This was the safest place to run - Alan Marsh, owner.

quotes.race: Barry Hills Further Flight Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was really straightforward, Trueshan got into a nice rhythm and the further he went the better. It was a great starting point. He's strengthened up really nicely and it doesn't feel like five minutes ago we were winning around Ascot. Today wasn't D-day but I was really happy with him. He's done so well physically and I don't see why he can't be even better this year. Hollie Doyle, jockey

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I was more nervous today because of the fact it had only been two weeks since Longchamp. Trueshan was quite a handful to saddle and quite hot. I don't think he was at his best but I think we got away with it today, but only just. He had to be very brave today - the runner-up kept coming back at us and I thought Stradivarius ran a great race. Let's hope we get a wet Royal Ascot next year as it would be lovely to run him in the Gold Cup - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trueshan is a superstar on this ground. We weren't going very quick early on and he was a little keen but I just let him slide up on to the girth of the leader and he took up the bridle on me. The further he went the better and he found another gear - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: tote+ Pays You More At tote.co.uk Ormonde Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled to bits with Trueshan. It's been worrying me that he's been ready to run for the last three or four weeks - we were going to go to Nottingham and then Ascot and I wasn't sure I could hang on to him for much longer. It was lovely to get a run into him and I was thrilled with the way he's run. It's a good start. I was actually fairly relaxed today because it was a prep and it was a big ask given weight away - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It's unbelievable. Obviously we'd hoped Trueshan would run well but we weren't expecting something like that. You couldn't expect that, but obviously the step up in trip suited him and we know he does handle that ground. Win or lose it was always going to be his last run of the season. We'll put him away for the winter now and look forward to next summer and the Cup races. - Alan King, trainer

quotes.race: British European Breeders' Fund Conditions Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: I thought we were in trouble when Hamish loomed upsides but he battled really well. He has schooled but he is not going jumping. He is going to have his winter holiday now. He's done enough. I am thrilled with him. They are two good horses. He wouldn't want fast ground and I thought he was floundering a bit on that today. Good or good to soft would be ideal. We will work back from the Ebor which would be a mid-season target for him next year - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Old Rowley Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Trueshan was going to go jumping but he may stay on the Flat after that. William (Buick) said he could be an Ebor horse -  Colin McKenzie, part-owner.

quotes.race: Prix Royal - Oak (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Obviously, there was a slight worry that the Cadran might have left its mark, but I talked a lot with Maxime and he wasn't hard on Double Major when he felt his chance was gone that day. Kyprios is obviously a very good horse. He gallops his rivals into the ground and breaks their hearts. We'll probably run across him at one stage or another next year, but over 3,000 metres [one mile seven furlongs] it might be a slightly different proposition than in a Gold Cup or a Cadran, neither of which will be on Double Major's schedule for next year. Now he's in top form, we'll keep him around in the yard and he can lead the babies and his little brother, and we'll prepare for Dubai I think - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Maurice de Nieuil presente par Radio FG (Group 2) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Double Major had a long break over the winter and he took a while to come to himself. He hasn't been running badly but it wasn't his best. Now everything is right with him and the rain an hour before the race only helped his cause. He enjoyed himself out front and was able to beat them with that long finishing kick of his. He'll be back for the autumn but Goodwood isn't ruled out, we'll give it some thought and keep an eye on the weather - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Royal-Oak (Group 1) (3yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's always something to win a Group 1 at any stage of the year. What Double Major has done there is just mad. He had the perfect trip, having his own way up front and by the time they got to the false straight, he already had the others on the stretch, while Maxime hadn't yet moved. I wondered what he'd find but he accelerated regardless of the ground and he's just a crack, a very, very good horse. We'll have to think about what we want to do. He's entitled to a holiday now and he'll need some downtime after that effort and the others during the season. We'll make a decision about where we want to go, whether we want to have a crack at Dubai or not - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

runners.name: Horizon Dore
runners.owner: Gousserie Racing, Ecurie Du Sud Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Gousserie Racing, Ecurie Du Sud Et Al
Gousserie Racing, Ecurie Du Sud Et Al

quotes.race: Prix d'Ispahan (Group 1) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's always hard when you're beaten by such small margins, but Horizon Dore showed his true self today. We'll see how he comes out of it, but his options are the Prince of Wales's and the Eclipse, and hopefully he'll get a proper pace to run at in Britain - Pauline Chehboub, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Dollar (Group 2) (3yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: That run to the second post makes it difficult to judge as it's not what Horizon Dore is used to, but Mickael (Barzalona) knows him by heart. If he recovers well we can look forward to trying to win back the title that Sealiway won for us in the Champion Stakes at Ascot - Pauline Chehboub, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Prix du Prince d'Orange (Group 3) (3yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We're delighted because Horizon Dore will come forward for this as we head to Arc weekend and the Prix Dollar. He wasn't at 100 per cent today, that's undeniable. And, as opposed to Sealiway's year, there is a three-week gap between Arc weekend and the Champion Stakes which is great - Pauline Chehboub, joint-owner.

quotes.race: Prix Eugene Adam (Group 2) (3yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Horizon Dore may be a gelding but he showed plenty of character as a two-year-old and even more this year. Still, we have a lot of hope invested in him and he showed his talent there. There are several options going forward and we'll have to discuss the options with the other co-owners. But Horizon Dore could very well run across the Channel, in America or even in Asia -  Pauline Chehboub of Gousserie Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He had a slow start to the year but his last two runs have been excellent. He really needs a good pace to run at and often races over ten furlongs in France lack that. Over a mile and a furlong in the d'Ispahan they went fast enough for him to produce that turn of foot. He's already run well at Ascot and, with his ability to accelerate and Mickael Barzalona on board, the real Horizon Dore he has a leading chance. 13-06-24

quotes.race: eventmasters.co.uk Paradise Stakes (A Queen Anne Stakes Trial) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I think Sardinian Warrior is a top-level horse. It would have taken a nice one to win today as there were some proper hardened yardsticks in there, so he had to run to his rating. There's improvement to come and that was a good effort. I haven't sat on him at home this year but I really liked him when he won his last start and I thought he had plenty of potential. He picked up and quickened really well - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

quotes.race: Boost Your Football Acca At Planet Sport Bet Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sardinian Warrior did everything I expected of him. He was in front a long way from home, he was still green and he possibly got tired. I always knew he was going to come on for today so that was very encouraging - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

quotes.race: Prix Ganay (Group 1) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. It was Sosie's first race of the season and the distance was a little bit short for him but he had the class to win. He's improved with age and we can now consider races like the King George [at Ascot]. He prefers good ground and wouldn't handle it too soft but with age horses get stronger - Andre Fabre, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Niel (Group 2) (3yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We came here knowing Sosie stayed the trip and that he adores Longchamp - this is his third win here. He's a horse who's really beginning to reach maturity. The question was how he would measure up to Look De Vega, but Maxime just rode his own race and he really picked up and ran all the way to the line. He's a very calm horse with a good temperament and that will stand him in good stead for the Arc - Pierre-Yves Bureau, racing manager for the owner.

quotes.race: Grand Prix de Paris (Group 1) (3yo Colts & Fillies) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Sosie is very unexposed and that's only his fifth race. He's a big frame of a horse and he is still growing into himself, for all that his previous runs have been very good. He was beaten at two  on terrible ground, so we were a little bit worried when the rain came earlier. He's very classy though and he showed that on holding ground in the Jockey Club. We'll talk with Andre but I don't think we'll try and change anything and the obvious races are the Niel and the Arc - Pierre-Yves Bureau, racing manager.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Jockey Club (Group 1) (3yo Colts & Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I would have liked Sosie to have had another race, but with the bad ground we couldn't run. I would say that she can go further - Andre Fabre, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco 1000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Elmalka got very unbalanced. She just took a couple of strides to organise herself. I was happy with the way she travelled but she's just inexperienced. She's very tough and I think the further she's going to go the better she's going to be. She's tough and she's learning and improving. She's very easy to ride. She switches off. I was always behind the bridle so when she goes up in trip it shouldn't be a problem - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey, speaking to ITV.

stable_tour.quote: She's wintered really well and she's from a family that improves with age, so I'm delighted Sheikh Ahmed kept her in training. She's not the biggest but she's much stronger this year and, although she didn't win after the Guineas last year, I think she ran three races which still told you she's a Group 1 filly. We'll start her in the Dahlia over nine furlongs on 1,000 Guineas day and that will give us some direction as to whether we try ten furlongs again or come back to a mile. I think she can win another Group 1. 11-04-25

runners.name: Dare To Dream
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux, Meridian International Sarl & Scuderia

quotes.race: Blandford Bloodstock Abernant Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We've had our eyes set on trying to make a stallion of Sajir at some point and Oisin said he wouldn't be out of place in trying to go for the six-furlong race at Royal Ascot (Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Stakes) next. If we want to make a stallion, that is maybe where we should aim but it will be decided by Prince Faisal (owner-breeder) and Andre. We could also look at York if we want to go over seven furlongs - we just need to convince Andre to leave Deauville alone! Prince Faisal is here and watched it from the stands. He had Remaat finish third in the Nell Gwyn yesterday and is delighted. He raced the sire Make Believe having bought him as a foal so it's very special for him and a nice start to the season. This horse started well last year but unfortunately got an abscess in his near hind, which kept opening up during the season. He just wasn't quite firing although he ran well each time. We were pleased how he went through the winter. After he won in France last month, we wanted to go for the Al Quoz but in the end just didn't think he was battle-hardened enough yet. Part of the thinking in coming here today was that it fits right and will hopefully will help to make a man of him. I am pleased we came here today - Ted Voute, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Prix Sigy (Group 3) (3yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We were a little bit worried about the distance going in, but we ran out of options because the ground has not been great everywhere. We had to run to tell us where we go next. Sajir handled the five and a half furlongs quite well from a bad draw. He's in the French Guineas but whether that's a little bit too far, I don't know. He's from a fast family and I think we'll let the dust settle and see whether we go up to seven, or whether the Prince wants to try him at a mile with the option to drop back. I think that's his call really - Ted Voute, owner's racing and bloodstock manager.

quotes.race: Godolphin Mile Sponsored By Emaar (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Great race. We rode King Gold to get the trip like we did the first time, he actually jumped a little bit slow today and must have thought he was going to go 2000 metres again I guess so I had to wake him up a little bit. I was never worried, he came good into the turn. The winner was too good but it felt like a win to us - Adrie de Vries, jockey.

quotes.race: Firebreak Stakes Presented By Longines (Group 3 (Dirt)
quotes.quote: We will go for the Godolphin Mile with King Gold now and maybe run on Super Saturday too - Marine Henry, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Arc Prix Maurice de Gheest (Group 1) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: King Gold had a few issues when he was younger but I think spending the winter in Dubai really helped him mentally, and something has really clicked. His work has never been better than in the last few weeks. Live I thought he'd won but on the replay, I thought we were second. Then they said the number eight and it's just crazy - Nicolas Caullery, trainer.

runners.name: Beauvatier
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux, Qatar Bloodstock Limited & Mme Barbara
runners.owner: Philippe Allaire, Haras Detreham & Lnj Foxwoods Sc

quotes.race: Prix de Fontainebleau (Group 3) (3yo Colts & Geldings) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: That was a good stepping stone to the Poule. I've brought Beauvatier along gently and hadn't worked him too hard, so I'm happy. He came to win his race and then the winner went again. Remember, he'd already had a run - Yann Barberot, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix la Rochette (Group 3) (2yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Beauvatier bowls me over every time he runs and indeed every time he works in the morning. He hadn't done a lot leading up to this because the Lagardere is his main objective, but he still won it in four strides. He just has that air of class - Yann Barberot, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Roland de Chambure (Listed Race) (2yo) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: From the moment the stalls opened Beauvatier pointed his ears and he was the winner at every stage thereafter. He didn't need to really accelerate hard at the end and I think he's just a very good horse. The only thing he lacks is a little bit of size and I'd love him to strengthen up behind, but he has an engine, that's for sure. I'll take my time and wait for the autumn, when he'll head to the Prix la Rochette - Yann Barberot, trainer.

quotes.race: Thoroughbred Industry Employee Awards Challenge Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Topgear is very easy to ride. He was very impressive when he won last time at Longchamp and I am very happy to see him back in good form today. He was unbeaten as a two-year-old and I felt he was a Group One horse. He is now coming back and I am very happy to see that. I think the plan could include going to Saudi Arabia with him next year. He is a good horse and there are good races to go for with for him - Stephane Pasquier, rider.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Gimcrack Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Lake Forest just ran awfully at Newmarket. He was in a state beforehand, he was upset, he was stupid to post and he was edgy in the stalls. Today he was really calm and really good going down. We saddled him in the stables and walked him across. He'd run a very good race in the July Stakes. We'd always planned to come here and his race last time nearly put us all off but why not have a go? You couldn't fancy him really although I said to my son I thought he'd run well. I think he'll get further. Tom said he went too early today - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson St Helens EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lake Forest is a sweet horse who's been fat and lazy all winter and suddenly came to hand three weeks ago. When Tom asked him to pick the bridle up, he went whoosh. He's got a good character and a nice attitude - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

prev_owners.owner: Mme Anja Wilde & F&O Hinderze Racing

runners.name: Exxtra
runners.breeder: Mme I Corbani & Sarl Jedburgh Stud

quotes.race: Prix du Palais-Royal (Group 3) (3yo+) (New Course: 2nd Post) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Exxtra spent the winter at Haras du Cadran with my good friend Pierre Talvard, and finished very well to be second on her return to action when not at 100 per cent. She goes on any ground but I was delighted to see the rain because she finds extra when it gets soft. She has grown up a lot and her long-term target is the Prix de la Foret back over this course and distance, but seeing how well she's done that she'll be prepared for the Prix Maurice de Gheest at Deauville in August - Carlos Lerner, joint-trainer.

3:15.going_detailed: TURF: GOOD TO SOFT (Good in places)

quotes.race: William Hill Prestige Fillies' Stakes (Group 3) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I couldn't pull Anshoda up afterwards, she will definitely get further. She is a light-framed filly and I think that helped in these very testing conditions - Billy Loughnane, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Ellaria Sand
runners.owner: B V Sangster, Mrs P Shanahan, Mrs M V Magnier

quotes.race: Highclere Thoroughbred Racing Stakes (Registered As The Radley Stakes) (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We knew Ellaria Sand would like the ground, so when conditions are like they are then it's a big feather in the cap - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

runners.name: Flaming Stone
runners.breeder: Mrs A Wigan & Juddmonte Farms Ltd

7:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Quick Money
runners.comment: Sure to improve for 6f after beating several of these over 5f; 7lb penalty makes it harder
runners.spotlight: Justified very short odds to win the second of his two appearances having been beaten a short head on debut; he needed all of the 5f to assert last time to beat the reopposing Babieca by half a length; 7lb worse off with that rival but looks a natural candidate to improve for this step up to 6f.

runners.name: Kiama
runners.breeder: Shane Molan & Lope De Vega Syndicate
runners.comment: Top pedigree; can better debut fourth behind Quick Money but 7f+ is what he aspires to
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega half-brother to triple Hong Kong Group 1 winner Waikuku (7f/1m) and to Group 3 Royal Ascot winner Waipiro (1m2f); likely to leave behind his debut fourth behind Quick Money (5f; beaten just over 6l) as he steps up in distance; this extra furlong compared to his debut will help, but he will be in his element when tackling 7f+.

runners.name: King Dance
runners.comment: Breeding and trials suggest he will shine when tackling around 1m; best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Boasts a decent pedigree, being by Kentucky Derby winner Nyquist and a half-brother to six-time winner Awesome Aaron; crossed the line first in a moderate trial last month and his breeding and workouts suggest he will flourish when tackling 1m on the back of some experience.

runners.name: Light Years Glory
runners.comment: Nicely bred but trials have not set the pulse racing; may need time and a longer trip
runners.spotlight: Son of the speedy Group 1 performer Advertise and the first foal of a mare who won at 7f but is from a family which stays well; has taken part in plenty of trials and while he has shown some ability, not enough to have people queueing up to support him on debut.

runners.name: Motor
runners.comment: Found 5f too sharp in both starts; never able to get on terms when third to Quick Money
runners.spotlight: Has found 5f too sharp in both of his appearances and was never able to get on terms when just over 5l third to Quick Money on latest; should appreciate the extra furlong and has place hopes again.

runners.name: Sparkle And Gold
runners.comment: Well beaten both starts; should find his level in handicap company next season
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on both appearances, finishing adrift of Quick Money and Babieca each time; one who should be more competitive when he finds his level in handicap company.

runners.name: Young Fighter
runners.comment: This sprint trip is unlikely to suit this stoutly bred gelding, as confirmed in his trials
runners.spotlight: This trip is unlikely to play to the strengths of this stoutly bred gelding; that assertion is backed by what he has shown in barrier trials.

runners.name: Babieca
runners.comment: Pushed cosy winner Quick Money to half a length; 7lb pull and extra furlong can help
runners.spotlight: Twice behind Quick Money but much closer last time when beaten just half a length; ran green in front when asked to quicken and he can improve again for that experience; should relish the move up to 7f and enjoys a 7lb pull with the cosy winner; a leading contender.

runners.name: Hyannis Star
runners.comment: Expect big progress from him after his debut; bred to be a smart sprinter and has claims
runners.spotlight: Finished a 7l fourth behind The All Out on debut (5f) when Quick Money and Babieca finished ahead of him; showed good speed until the final furlong and his brother Cordyceps Six was well beaten in that race but went on to win six times, including at Group 3 Handicap level; expect him to go much closer this time.

runners.name: Win Method
runners.comment: Likely to improve from his first start but might be best when taking on handicap company
runners.spotlight: Revealed decent pace but faded quickly in the final furlong when crossing the line 7l behind Quick Money on debut; needs to find plenty more and that is not impossible, but it is in handicaps that he might find his feet.

runners.name: Winning Champion
runners.comment: Sprint bred; went well in his second barrier trial; this is a very different examination
runners.spotlight: First foal of a speedy dual-winning mare and by a talented Group 1 sprinter in Alabama Express; advanced from a slow-starting trial to show bags of pace in a similar workout this month; that suggests he is heading in the right direction but this is a very different examination.

runners.name: Bravehearts
runners.comment: 3-7 for new stable this season, with the last two wins gained over C&D; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: 3-7 for new stable this season, with the last two wins gained over C&D; not beaten far when fourth of six in Group 3 handicap here (1m4f) three weeks ago and has each-way claims at least today.

runners.name: Fallon
runners.comment: In very good form but recent 7lb rise asks quite a lot of him
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form 5yo who scored over 1m1f here last month and has now won two of his last four; latest 7lb rise asks quite a lot of him today, though.

runners.name: Family Jewel
runners.owner: Tony Stradmoor, Billy Li Sze Kuen Et Al
runners.comment: Good fourth over C&D since last month's pushed-out 1m win; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Needed only to be pushed out to win over 1m here two starts ago and stayed on well for fourth behind Liveandletlive over C&D when back up in trip three weeks ago; ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Enthralled
runners.comment: C&D winner in March; first-time blinkers may squeeze out more from him today
runners.spotlight: Ex-British 4yo who came good in Hong Kong with C&D win in March; managed only fifth in recent C&D contest won by Liveandletlive but the new blinkers may squeeze out something extra today.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: James Webb is still a little bit raw. You can see he's a big horse. I think the flat track today made all the difference - P J McDonald, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Agenda
runners.owner: Albert Hung Chao Hong & Stephanie Hung Yujie

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant

runners.comment: Smart when trained in Ireland but safely held on all four Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Group 3 runner-up when trained in Ireland by Aidan O'Brien but safely held on all four Hong Kong starts this year (1m1f-1m3f); swaps cheekpieces for first-time blinkers today.

quotes.race: View Restaurant At Dundalk Stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Agenda had a lovely run last year at the Curragh in a race that worked out nicely and has the makings of a lovely horse - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We have a few possibles for the King Edward VII Stakes and this chap is one of them. He ran well in the Chester Vase and seems to have taken a nice jump forward from two to three.. 12-6-24

runners.name: Winning Wing
runners.comment: Placed over C&D since last month's narrow 1m1f course win; respected
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who has made a solid start to his Hong Kong career; held on well for narrow 1m1f course win last month and posted another good effort when third over C&D three weeks ago; respected.

runners.name: Liveandletlive
runners.comment: Just held on to make all over C&D this month; 5lb rise demands further improvement today
runners.spotlight: Has rather mixed record during this first Hong Kong season but was evidently suited by the step up in trip when just holding on to make all over C&D three weeks ago; 5lb rise demands more improvement today.

quotes.race: Betfred 'Bet Builder' Sankey Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I've always thought a lot of Liveandletlive. If he goes up high enough to get in the Britannia I'll take him to Ascot - William Muir, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Gold Master
runners.owner: Sherman T W Cheung, Tina T T Yan & Joyce T T Sum
runners.comment: Dual Class 4 winner this season; beaten in photo-finishes in both Class 3 races; respected
runners.spotlight: Improving 4yo who has won twice in Class 4 here this season (1m/1m1f) and was beaten only in photo-finishes on first two starts in this grade, latterly by Liveandletlive over C&D three weeks ago; obvious contender.

runners.name: Packing Hurricane
runners.comment: Fourth over 1m1f here in March but two lesser efforts have followed; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key stable debut when fourth over 1m1f here in March but two lesser efforts have followed (1m1f/1m2f); others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Master Trillion
runners.comment: Won when upped to 1m two months ago; up in grade today but tries another new trip
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win when upped to 1m here two months ago and now has 2-7 strike-rate; moves up in grade today but further progress is possible over this even longer trip.

runners.name: Mega Force

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Yet to make a significant impact after five Hong Kong runs (7f-1m3f)
runners.spotlight: Very useful when based in Ireland but yet to make a significant impact after five Hong Kong runs (7f-1m3f) and may need a drop in grade.

quotes.race: Pat "The Duke" Leavy Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Gasper De Lemos had a lovely run first day and he will be very happy stepping up to 1m. He is a middle-distance horse for next year. He's more one for the Futurity than the Dewhurst - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden over 7f at the Curragh and finished second in the Zetland Stakes over 1m2f. He's done well and is working nicely at the moment. He'll step into a Derby trial on a nice bit of ground. 03-04-24

runners.name: Fast Speed
runners.owner: Howard Tai Wai Yin & Yim Hin Keung
