runners.comment: Well down the field on first three Hong Kong starts (5f-1m)
runners.spotlight: Well down the field on first three Hong Kong starts (5f-1m); very difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Lean Hero
runners.comment: Placed twice (1m/1m1f) from five starts at Happy Valley this year but others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Placed twice (1m/1m1f) from five starts at Happy Valley this year but his latest run was disappointing and he's not the percentage call today.

runners.name: Mighty Strength
runners.breeder: Simms Davison & Mrs J C Hewitt
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Li Ming On, Joyce Li Lok Yan & Henry Li Lok Him
runners.comment: Class 4 C&D winner in March but safely held in this higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Stayed on strongly to score over C&D in Class 4 in March; still unexposed over this trip but was safely held in C&D contest won by Liveandletlive when upped to this grade three weeks ago.

runners.name: Sharpen Bright
runners.comment: In the frame five consecutive times since 1m1f win in October
runners.spotlight: Very consistent 5yo who has made the frame five consecutive times (1m1f-1m3f) since his narrow win at Happy Valley (1m1f) in October; solid each-way claims if he gets a run today.

runners.name: Anode
runners.comment: Made low-key Hong Kong debut last month (6f) and is drawn much wider today
runners.spotlight: Listed winner and Group-placed over 6f-1m in Australia but made a low-key Hong Kong debut here (6f) three weeks ago and is drawn much wider today; needs a good boost from the first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Ghorgan
runners.comment: Smart when trained in Germany but first two HK runs were very disappointing; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Smart when trained in Germany but was very disappointing on both Hong Kong starts for Jamie Richards (1m); now with another new stable; others have much less to prove.

runners.name: Geneva
runners.comment: Progressive 4yo; triple 6f course winner this season; still unexposed over 7f
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who has collected three 6f course wins this season; perhaps a shade disappointing when last in action but could plausibly have untapped potential over 7f.

runners.name: Pope Cody
runners.comment: Stayed on for fourth over C&D last month, his second HK start; might have more to offer
runners.spotlight: 3-5 when based in Australia; well down the field over C&D on Hong Kong debut in March but belied 80-1 odds when staying-on fourth here last month and it will be interesting to see whether he can build on that effort.

runners.name: Master Champion

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Safely held on first two Hong Kong starts, both over 6f on dirt; up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Safely held on first two Hong Kong starts, both over 6f on dirt; needs this different trip-and-surface combination to show him in a much better light.

runners.name: Eighty Light Years
runners.comment: In good form over C&D in recent months and has much better draw that on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice over C&D in March/April and also ran well when fifth here on latest outing; much better drawn today and can make his presence felt again.

runners.name: South Star
runners.comment: Eased-down C&D winner in March and readily followed up in this higher grade last month
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who opened his account eased-down C&D win in March and readily followed up in this higher grade last month; drawn well again today and probably still has more improvement to come; commands respect.

runners.name: Top Dragon
runners.owner: Vincent To Wai Keung, K To Kin Ting & R To Yiu Ting
runners.comment: Up in grade after very comfortable C&D win last month but further progress is likely
runners.spotlight: Came good at fifth attempt, keeping on strongly to win very comfortably over C&D last month; 9lb higher in a higher-grade race today but Zac Purton keeps the ride and further progress seems likely.

runners.name: Igor Stravinsky
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Cyrus Li Kin Wai

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Unable to land a blow over C&D on first two Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Looked useful when winning 7f maiden in Ireland just over a year ago but was unable to land a blow on his two C&D starts last month.

runners.name: Akashvani
runners.comment: Twice in the frame over 6f since winning debut in March; tries a new trip today
runners.spotlight: Twice in the frame over 6f since his winning debut over that trip in March, latterly when upped to this grade; drawn wide for this first attempt at 7f but probably still has potential.

runners.name: Super Express
runners.comment: C&D winner on debut and went very close here on second start; up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Stayed on strongly to justify odds-on favouritism over C&D on debut in March and lost out only narrowly to a strong finisher here last month; moves up in grade today but still warrants close attention.

runners.name: Ka Ying Superb
runners.breeder: D R Haworth, K & M Miles Et Al
runners.comment: Just held on to open HK account over C&D last month; has more on his plate today
runners.spotlight: Just held on to open Hong Kong account over C&D this month, his ninth attempt; evidently in good nick but moves back up in grade today and others have more exciting profiles.

runners.name: King Of Dubai
runners.comment: Ran quite well over 6f this month but needs further improvement over this new trip
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo; took a step forward when fifth over 6f here three weeks ago, his third Hong Kong start, but needs today's longer trip to unlock significant further improvement.

runners.name: Lost Child
runners.comment: Last two C&D runs were very respectable but lightly raced rivals appeal much more
runners.spotlight: Seems to have turned a corner with two very respectable C&D runs in recent weeks but is eligible for Class 4 races now and some of his lightly raced rivals in this field are much more appealing.

runners.name: Hong Kong Hall
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Chew Fook Aun & Alexander Chew Wei Khen
runners.comment: 62.5% rate of making the first two from eight C&D runs (two wins); in poor form in Class 3
runners.spotlight: Has shown a liking for this C&D, with a 62.5% record of making the first two from eight attempts, including two wins; his six runs this season have been very disappointing, having been beaten an aggregate of 77 lengths; that poor run sees him back in this grade for the first time since winning off a 1lb lower mark in January 2024.

runners.name: Awesome Treasure
runners.breeder: A D, J D & Mrs L J E Scoular
runners.comment: On a mark 1lb below his last winning one but has shown next to nothing in eight runs since
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in 66.6% of his 24 C&D appearances (two wins); although he is on a handicap mark 1lb below that from which he scored in October, he has shown next to nothing in eight subsequent outings; others preferred.

runners.name: Call Me Gorgeous
runners.breeder: Grimley B B A Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Best run yet dropped to this level last time; first-time blinkers and a major contender
runners.spotlight: A winner in Australia (5.5f) but a pair of fourth-place finishes is his record from seven starts in Hong Kong; they have come in his last three appearances and he stayed on late last time to be beaten just over two lengths; that was his first run in Class 4 and a decent effort in the context of this race; his weight record suggests that he is now at peak fitness; first-time blinkers may help him to be a major player.

runners.name: Beauty Missile
runners.comment: Beaten a neck or less four times but this 29-race maiden is inconsistent; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Capable of some useful performances (four times he has gone down by a neck or less) but he remains a maiden after 29 starts; he has finished in the money six times in 11 C&D outings (54.5%) but turned in a poor effort last time and is simply inconsistent.

runners.name: Bullish Pride
runners.owner: Wong Wing Keung & Cheung Ka Ho
runners.comment: Well beaten on his debut last month when sent off at a big price; much better is needed
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on his debut last month when sent off at a big price; that experience is likely to have helped him and he went okay in a subsequent trial, albeit a place behind Beauty Missile after being quite hard ridden; difficult to make a case for him but worth monitoring with the future in mind.

runners.name: Circuit Century
runners.owner: Ho Yin Sang & Tsang Kin Wa
runners.comment: Breeding reads well but his trials were a mixed bag; he can benefit from time and races
runners.spotlight: Comes from a family with plenty of speed and three of his four siblings are winners; his barrier trials have been a mixed bag and while he appeals on pedigree, his morning efforts suggests he may well benefit from time and experience.

runners.name: Invincible Ibis
runners.comment: Nicely bred; trial work has been progressive, showing him in a good light; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Brings plenty of promise on paper, in terms of breeding and his showings in the barrier trials; both elements mark him downs as a sprinter who could see out 7f, too; his trial work has been progressive and shown him in a good light; one to consider, especially is there is any money for him.

runners.name: No Other Choice
runners.breeder: Bred To Win Thoroughbreds Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Cheng Chung Wah & Enzo Cheng Tin Hang
runners.comment: Revealed good early speed in most of his trials and Hugh Bowman is an interesting booking
runners.spotlight: Revealed good early speed in most of his trials, which is in contrast to what might have been expected from his family tree; Hugh Bowman was on board in three of his last six trials and takes the ride, which is of interest.

runners.name: Sunny Sing Spirit
runners.comment: Beaten more than 11 lengths on debut and turned in a poor trial effort last week
runners.spotlight: Although he ended up by being beaten more than 11 lengths on debut, he was not friendless in the market; improvement is required, especially given a poor trial effort last week.

runners.name: Goldentronicmighty
runners.comment: Always prominent and commanded the final furlong for his C&D win; place hopes at least
runners.spotlight: Having shown glimpses of ability in his first eight starts, he was prominent throughout and commanded the final furlong to land a first success here last month; that was over C&D but he has an 8lb rise to overcome for that two-length victory; place hopes at least.

runners.name: Divine Moonlight
runners.breeder: G W & Mrs M W Simon
runners.comment: Three well-beaten starts don't inspire confidence but he won a barrier trial last week
runners.spotlight: Three well-beaten unplaced career starts don't inspire confidence but he's had three months off and freshened up for this with a barrier trial win last week; he was too free that day and still has plenty to prove.

runners.name: King Alloy
runners.breeder: China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Lun Ka Leung & Yeung Hiu Yu
runners.comment: There has not been much in the way of encouragement from three unplaced appearances
runners.spotlight: There has not been much in the way of encouragement from three unplaced appearances, and he was beaten ten lengths or more on his last two attempts.

runners.name: Taihang Scenery
runners.comment: Good C&D third in July; five runs this year have not shown him in a favourable light
runners.spotlight: If you go back to July, he enters calculations on his close third to Super Bonus over this C&D; after that he was not seen again until February after being injured last year; his five efforts this year do not advertise his chance in a favourable light.

runners.name: Shine Bright
runners.comment: Fair fourth on his penultimate start; however, there has been another heavy defeat since
runners.spotlight: There have been just two glimmers of ability in his seven outings, particularly when a fair fourth on his penultimate start; however, there has been another heavy defeat since and it requires plenty of guesswork to side with him.

runners.name: Ka Ying Warrior
runners.comment: May have needed last run when not disgraced; a useful record over this 6f; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Has one win and a 60% rate of finishing in the first two from five runs over this 6f; picked up that victory in February but then had a three-month break before performing adequately off this 5lb higher mark; he ran as if possibly needing the outing and was beaten just over two lengths.

runners.name: Tourbillon Golfer
runners.owner: Shum Mak Ling, Justin Liu Sai Wai & Wilson Liu Chung Kin
runners.comment: Sprint-bred newcomer has improved with each trial, winning one this month
runners.spotlight: Has improved with each trial, winning one this month; both sides of his pedigree feature strong sprinting credentials.

runners.name: Giddy Up
runners.comment: Back in the mix when at Happy Valley on his penultimate outing; remains on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough with a 7f success last season and was back in the mix when finishing a close second at Happy Valley on his penultimate outing; remains on a workable mark and can play a role.

runners.name: Northern Beaches
runners.comment: Failed to build on a pleasing return last month; tough draw to overcome today
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over the minimum trip here last season; failed to build on a pleasing return when finishing down the field last month; tough draw to overcome today.

runners.name: Call To Command
runners.comment: Comprehensively beaten in four local starts; impossible to recommend at present
runners.spotlight: Comprehensively beaten in four local starts; impossible to recommend at present.

runners.name: Audacious Pursuit
runners.comment: NZD$260,000 yearling; has shown some ability in local barrier trials; consult market
runners.spotlight: NZD$260,000 yearling; has shown some ability in local barrier trials; consult market.

runners.name: Billion Two
runners.comment: Sent off at a big price on last month's debut and ran accordingly; longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: Sent off at a big price on last month's debut and ran accordingly; remains a longer-term prospect.

runners.name: Copartner Fleet
runners.comment: Made a good impression in his latest trial; any market support must be taken seriously
runners.spotlight: AUD$130,000 yearling; made a good impression when scoring over today's trip in his latest barrier trial; awkward stall to overcome on debut but any market support must be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Inno Super
runners.owner: Dr Ng Chi Ho, Steve Chuang Tzu Hsiung Et Al
runners.comment: Performed only moderately in recent trials; looks one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: Capitalist gelding; has performed only moderately in recent trials; looks one for further down the line.

runners.name: Voyage Boss
runners.owner: Tommy Ching Tsun Wah, Fujisawa Tasayoshi Et Al
runners.comment: Kept on under pressure on his latest trial over today's trip; drawn well for debut
runners.spotlight: NZD$100,000 yearling; kept on under pressure when finishing second on his latest trial over today's trip; drawn well for official debut.

runners.name: Honest Witness
runners.owner: Arthur Antonio Da Silva, Betty Da Silva & Teresa Da Silva
runners.comment: Has made a pleasing start to his career; no reason why he shouldn't be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Has made a pleasing start to his career, posting consecutive fourth-place finishes; no reason why he shouldn't be in the mix for minor honours once again.

runners.name: Loveisintheair
runners.comment: Appeared to take a backward step 18 days ago; capable of getting back on track here
runners.spotlight: Was staying on strongly when finishing a close third over today's trip at Happy Valley last month but appeared to take a backward step 18 days ago; looks more than capable of getting back on track here.

runners.name: Lakeshore Hero
runners.comment: Unlucky not to strike in February; latest effort on the dirt was a long way below par
runners.spotlight: Unlucky not to strike when rattling home to finish a close second over 7f here in February; latest effort on the dirt was a long way below par; makes a quick switch back to turf.

runners.name: Looks Outstanding
runners.owner: Dennis Chow Chi In, Choi Yuk Ping & Edward Tsui Wing Tak
runners.comment: Made a pleasing start his career but has failed to build on that effort; switched to turf
runners.spotlight: Made a pleasing start his career, finishing a creditable fifth, but has failed to build on that effort in two subsequent outings; now switched to turf.

runners.name: Blue Baron
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Mark Fong Chung, Matthew Fong & Victoria Fong

prev_owners.owner: Mark Fong Chung, Matthew Fong & Victoria Fong

runners.comment: Debut effort was respectable but three underwhelming outings have followed
runners.spotlight: Debut effort was respectable but three underwhelming outings have followed; others readily preferred.

runners.name: Circuit Victory
runners.comment: Took a step forward when making all three weeks ago; better company to contend with today
runners.spotlight: Took a big step forward when making all to score over C&D in a Class 5 event three weeks ago; 6lb rise and better company to contend with today.

runners.name: Euro Rocks
runners.comment: Longstanding local maiden; moderate in four outings this term and hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden; moderate in four outings this term and hard to make a strong case for returning from a break.

runners.name: Riding High

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Generally disappointing in ten local starts; plenty more still required
runners.spotlight: Generally disappointing in ten local starts but did hint at some ability when finishing third over C&D on New Year's Day; plenty more still required.

runners.name: Packing Hermod
runners.comment: Continued his upward curve in March; 7lb rise makes life tougher but likely more to come
runners.spotlight: Continued his upward curve when scoring over C&D in March; subsequent 7lb rise makes life tougher but he still could have plenty left in the tank.

runners.name: Young Champion
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Returned to the winner's enclosure in March; latest effort wasn't so good
runners.spotlight: Returned to the winner's enclosure when scoring over C&D in March and ran well off his revised rating in his subsequent outing; latest effort wasn't so good.

quotes.race: John R Fitzpatrick Agricultural Contractor Maiden
quotes.quote: Sharlouk is improving. He's still learning but he travels like a very good horse. He has an engine and he will improve with racing. He's not too bad - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: The Golden Scenery
runners.comment: Group 3 handicap winner on return; form has dipped but he does arrive on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Made the perfect start to his current campaign when winning a Group 3 handicap in September; form has dipped since but he does now arrive on a workable mark.

runners.name: Mid Winter Wind
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See
runners.comment: Caused an upset on Hong Kong debut; yet to really kick on in three outings since
runners.spotlight: Caused an upset when staying on strongly to score at 41-1 odds on Hong Kong debut; yet to really kick on in three outings since but it remains early days; likely has more to offer at some point.

runners.name: Swift Ascend
runners.comment: Progress seems to have halted since the turn of the year; step forward needed
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive at the start of his current campaign but that progress seems to have halted since the turn of the year; step forward needed.

runners.name: Dancing Code

prev_owners.owner: L A Miller, Mrs M L Morrison Et Al

runners.comment: Gained his third local victory on New Year's Day; has remained competitive in this grade
runners.spotlight: Gained his third local victory when scoring over 6f here in a Class 3 event on New Year's Day; has remained competitive in this grade since but more is needed for win purposes.

runners.name: Mickley
runners.comment: Made an early local breakthrough; has failed to add to that success in eight starts since
runners.spotlight: Made an early local breakthrough when staying on strongly to score on only his second start in December; has failed to add to that success in eight starts since.

quotes.race: Britannia Stakes (Heritage Handicap) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Huge performance, a very classy horse. Mickley only does whatever is asked of him, and I was hopeful that the big-field scenario like this would really bring out his best and keep him thinking. It did that, and the step up in trip has obviously helped him. It was very smooth, really, from start to finish - he got a nice pitch and a bit of cover, but plenty of room to run into. He came under me from two and a half out and I was really confident then that with a clear run to the line, he'd take some pegging back.  I've always really liked this horse and he's so laidback, but always works to a very good level at home and never does any more than is required of him. I'm so pleased he could show how good he is - Callum Rodriguez, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He got a mark of 90 after winning at Doncaster and I'd think he'll get in the Britannia now. It was another fact-finding mission and he's of a level to have a crack at something like that. He's got a great mind, which will help him at Ascot, and I hope he'll stay the stiff mile. He's a lovely horse to have. 10-06-24

I have a lot of time for this colt, who's a fine, big individual from a fast family. He'll be ready to start in midsummer over 5f or 6f. He's not in fast work but is doing all I've asked and looks the part. 01-06-23

runners.name: Atullibigeal
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last season but yet to run up to that form in seven outings this term
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season but yet to run up to that form in seven outings this term; a more convincing performance is needed.

runners.name: Meowth
runners.comment: Caused an upset on debut; form since has been a bit hit and miss; down in grade
runners.spotlight: Caused an upset when scoring at 39-1 odds on his racecourse debut in November; form since has been a bit hit and miss; today's ease in grade aids his chances.

runners.name: Speedy Trident
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in four local starts to date; can't be recommended.
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in four local starts to date; can't be recommended.

runners.name: Super Love
runners.comment: Made an early career breakthrough in February; plausible excuses drawn wide last month
runners.spotlight: Made an early career breakthrough when scoring on only his second start, over C&D in February; plausible excuses when drawn wide last month; can bounce back.

runners.name: Monarch County
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Hamen Fan Shi Hoo, Alex F C Yen & Christina F C Mun
runners.comment: Off the mark on his penultimate outing; ran well off his revised mark last time; chance
runners.spotlight: Stayed on strongly when getting off the mark over C&D on his penultimate outing; ran well off his revised mark last time, so should have a say again today.

runners.name: Big Stride
runners.comment: 60-1 for last month's racecourse debut and ran accordingly; best watched
runners.spotlight: 60-1 for last month's racecourse debut and ran accordingly; remains best watched for now.

runners.name: Ka Ying Glory
runners.comment: Last of 14 when odds-on for debut; needs to settle; blinkers added; worth a second chance
runners.spotlight: Heavily backed into odds-on for debut in March but finished last of 14; blinkers are added; will have to settle much better to make amends for that defeat but he may well be worth a second chance.

runners.name: Lucky Statement
runners.owner: Cheng Yu Wai, Cheng Mei Mei Et Al
runners.comment: Showed improvement when fifth over C&D two weeks ago; now needs to build on that run.
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on first two starts but did show some improvement when fifth over C&D two weeks ago; now needs to build on that run.

runners.name: Beauty Live
runners.comment: Back in the mix over C&D two weeks ago; a long way below his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Yet to snap a long losing sequence but was back in the mix when making the frame over C&D two weeks ago; a long way below his last winning mark, so has to be considered.

runners.name: Do Your Part
runners.comment: Modest in his eight local starts but has shown some progress in recent months
runners.spotlight: Modest in his eight local starts but has shown some progress in recent months; more still needed for win purposes.

runners.name: Flying Double
runners.owner: Raymond Tsang Heung Tak & Kenneth Tsang Heung Kan
runners.comment: Two outings since the turn of the year have been disappointing; needs to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Knocking on the door early in his career but two outings since the turn of the year have been disappointing; needs to get back on track.

runners.name: Sunny Q
runners.comment: Not disgraced in his first four career starts but yet to get seriously competitive
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in his first four career starts but yet to get seriously competitive; can only be watched for now.

runners.name: Bling Bling Genius
runners.comment: Showed improvement when fourth over C&D three weeks ago; now needs to build on that outing
runners.spotlight: Safely held on his first three career starts but did show some improvement when finishing fourth over C&D three weeks ago; now needs to build on that outing.

runners.name: He Was Me

prev_owners.owner: Price Bloodstock Management Ltd & Farmhouse Holdings P/L

runners.comment: Largely disappointing in his eight local starts; future may lie in lower grades
runners.spotlight: Largely disappointing in his eight local starts; future may lie in lower grades.

runners.name: Yodas Choice
runners.owner: Alan Lee Yu Sing & Estate Of The Late Lee Kwok Kay
runners.comment: Made his belated breakthrough in March; held off his revised mark in higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Made his belated breakthrough when scoring over 1m1f on the Sha Tin dirt in March; held off his revised mark in this higher grade since; another step forward is needed.

runners.name: Arden
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs James Tien Pei Chun
runners.comment: Posted a respectable effort from a wide draw two weeks ago; plenty more still required
runners.spotlight: Poor in his first four career starts but fifth from a wide draw over C&D two weeks ago; plenty more still required.

runners.name: Glory Cloud
runners.comment: Maiden but has threatened on a couple of occasions this season; blinkers go on
runners.spotlight: Maiden but has threatened on a couple of occasions this season; looks more than capable of striking off his current mark; blinkers go on.

runners.name: Flagship Warrior

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J A Macgillivray, D J Clarken Et Al

runners.comment: Yet to add to his debut success but he has threatened in better company; chance here
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his debut success but he has threatened in better company on a couple of occasions this season; feared dropping into today's lower grade.

runners.name: Setanta
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See

prev_owners.owner: Aquis Farm, C J Barham Et Al

runners.comment: Form has tailed off slightly since the turn of the year; 2lb above his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Remained in good heart at the start of his current campaign but his form has tailed off slightly since the turn of the year; remains 2lb above his last winning mark.

runners.name: Bright Inheritance
runners.owner: 23/24 Dennis C H Yip Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Darby Racing, A R Burfoot Et Al
Darby Racing, G Bachell Et Al

runners.comment: Returned to the winner's enclosure last month; scored off a 3lb higher mark last season
runners.spotlight: Returned to the winner's enclosure when staying on strongly to score over C&D last month; 6lb rise demands more but he did strike last season off a 3lb higher mark.

runners.name: Namjong Kingdom
runners.comment: Six local starts to date have been disappointing; off since March and has changed trainers
runners.spotlight: Six local starts to date have been disappointing; off since March and has changed trainers.

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Blackwater Handicap
quotes.quote: Marty The Party ran a good race in a maiden at the Curragh and I was hoping he was going to be a bit of value off 85 so it's worked out nice. It wouldn't bother me to step him back up in trip, he should get a mile and a quarter anyway. Joey (Sheridan, jockey) said he travels and he's able to put him wherever he wants, but he goes to sleep at the same time which will hopefully make him stay a bit further. I'll see what the handicapper does. He's in the Amethyst but that might come a little bit too soon in a fortnight's time. The Gallinule on Guineas weekend could be a possibility, we'll see - Fozzy Stack, trainer, speaking on Racing TV

runners.name: Fortune Boy
runners.owner: Ricky Wong Kin Chat & Helen Leung Yee Wan
runners.comment: Showed gradual improvement before gaining his breakthrough win; 6lb rise not beyond him
runners.spotlight: Showed gradual improvement before gaining his breakthrough success over C&D three weeks ago; subsequent 6lb rise doesn't look beyond him; Zac Purton takes the ride.

runners.name: Mister Dapper
runners.owner: P Chan Pak Hou, J Chan Chi Kwong & J Chan Chon San
runners.comment: Held off his revised mark in last two starts, so a step forward is now needed
runners.spotlight: Second career win when scoring over C&D in February; held off his revised mark in two starts since, so a step forward is now needed.

runners.name: Wrote A New Page
runners.owner: Sammy Ma Hon Kit & Ronald Ma Chun Ho
runners.comment: Lightly raced and took a step forward latest; every chance if replicating that effort
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and took a step forward when narrowly denied over C&D three weeks ago; every chance of having a say if replicating that effort.

runners.name: D Star
runners.comment: Gained his fourth win in October; underwhelming outings have followed
runners.spotlight: Gained his fourth win when scoring over the extended mile at Happy Valley in October but three underwhelming outings have followed; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: The Auspicious
runners.comment: Caused a big upset in March; can't be ignored, especially if a strong pace is set
runners.spotlight: Caused a big upset when rattling home to score at 131-1 over 7f here in March; again finished strongly when making the frame two weeks ago; can't be ignored, especially if a strong pace is set up front.

runners.name: Smart City

prev_owners.owner: A List Stud Pty Ltd, H W Tang & C H Suen

runners.comment: Performed with credit this season; needs to find something extra for win purposes
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden but has performed with credit this season; needs to find something extra to make his breakthrough.

runners.name: Special Hedge
runners.breeder: Mrs K A & N J Auret
runners.comment: Returned to the winner's enclosure in February and has remained competitive
runners.spotlight: Returned to the winner's enclosure when staying on strongly to score over 7f here in February; has remained competitive off his elevated mark, so should play a role again today.

runners.name: Smiling Collector
runners.breeder: Mapperley Stud Ltd & Windsor Park S
runners.comment: A bit hit and miss this term and has become hard to predict; others are less risky.
runners.spotlight: 7f winner here on his penultimate outing last season; a bit hit and miss this term and has become hard to predict; others are less risky.

runners.name: Storm Runner
runners.comment: Well beaten in all six career starts; future looks to be in Class 5
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in all six starts; future looks to be in Class 5.

runners.name: Fight Time
runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Daren Wong Wai Chow, Lau Kay Jing & Eric Liu Kar Hang
runners.comment: 0-15 but has hinted at a breakthrough on several occasions this season; contender
runners.spotlight: 0-15 but has hinted at a breakthrough on several occasions this season; dangerous to dismiss off today's low weight.

runners.name: California Sun
runners.comment: Outran huge odds on debut; today's extra furlong looks set to suit
runners.spotlight: Outran huge odds when staying on nicely to finish fourth on debut two weeks ago; today's extra furlong looks set to suit.

runners.name: Pearl Of Pangs
runners.breeder: Mrs B A & T G Spriggens
runners.comment: Best effort was in March; needs to bounce back from a disappointing run
runners.spotlight: Best effort when second over 7f here in March; needs to bounce back from a disappointing effort three weeks ago to stand any chance today.

runners.name: Spirit Of Peace
runners.owner: Fong Chung Man, Vincent Fong & Lucia Fong So Ching
runners.comment: Shade disappointing last time but was in good form beforehand; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Twice in the frame over C&D off today's mark since opening account over 6f here in January; slightly disappointing when last in action but not yet fully exposed and enters calculations.

runners.name: Forerunner
runners.owner: Ng Tai Wing, Anson Or Yiu Wah & Henry Yeung Mun Kin
runners.comment: Ended long losing run over C&D in January but form has dipped lately
runners.spotlight: Ended long losing spell with cosy C&D win in January and was runner-up here on next outing but has suffered a worrying dip in form since.

runners.name: Shamus Storm
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo who has been placed over C&D on three of his four starts; good chance
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who has been placed over C&D on three of his four starts; lost out only narrowly on most recent occasion three weeks ago and is well drawn again today; good chance.

runners.name: Max Que
runners.owner: Ricky Ng Yu Chiu & To Ngo Fung
runners.comment: Second over C&D on three of last four outings; seems likely to strike soon
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after seven runs but has finished second over C&D on three of his last four appearances and seems likely to hit the target soon.

runners.name: Mighty Steed
runners.comment: Respectable sixth over C&D on last two outings but has the outside draw today
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; returned from break with two respectable sixths over C&D in recent weeks but faces a tough task from stall 14 today.

runners.name: Dreaming Winner
runners.comment: Went close over 6f in February but two very disappointing C&D runs have followed
runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key debut when staying on well to go close over 6f here in February but two very disappointing C&D runs have followed and he now has questions to answer.

runners.name: Oldtown
runners.breeder: T B R Dixon & Haunui Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Fell in closing stages of debut in February but might have been placed with better luck
runners.spotlight: Might well have been placed with better luck on his debut in February (6f) but was denied a clear run inside the final furlong before stumbling and falling in the closing stages; could have a say.

runners.name: Vivacious Win
runners.comment: Makes official debut after some fairly encouraging trials but probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Out of an unraced mare who has produced a multiple 7f winner; makes official debut after some fairly encouraging trials but is probably best watched all the same.

runners.name: Sugar Queen Prawn
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on first two starts, the latter over C&D a fortnight ago
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on first two starts, the latter over C&D a fortnight ago; one for further down the line.

runners.name: Galvanic
runners.comment: Needs to better his recent efforts but has slipped to a tempting mark; could have a say
runners.spotlight: Needs to better his last couple of efforts but was placed three consecutive times in December-February (6f-7f) and has slipped to a tempting mark; could go well from stall 1.

runners.name: King Show
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four runs (6f-7f)
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four runs (6f-7f); swaps blinkers for first-time hood and cheekpieces.

runners.name: Precious Hill
runners.comment: Well beaten in four sprints; needs this step up to 7f to enable huge improvement
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in four sprints; needs this step up to 7f to enable huge improvement.

runners.name: Sunny Darling

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Mrs B C Bateman Et Al

runners.comment: Out of sorts this year and has a tough draw today
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season 6f form but has looked out of sorts this year and has a tough draw today.

runners.name: Only U
runners.comment: Fourth over C&D on last two outings but has basically become a bit disappointing
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for fourth over C&D on his last two appearances but has become rather disappointing and is eligible for a drop in grade now; others have more appealing profiles.

runners.name: Go General
runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for debut in March (5f)
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for debut in March (5f).

runners.name: Beauty Thunder
runners.comment: Went close over 6f last month and ought to be suited by this move back up in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-8 in Hong Kong but went close over 6f at Happy Valley last month and was denied a clear run when only sixth there 11 days ago; ought to be suited by this move back up in trip (won over 7.5f in Ireland) and will warrant consideration if he gets a run.

9:10.race_name: Standard Chartered Champions & Chater Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)

runners.name: Voyage Bubble
runners.comment: Four-time Group 1 winner; unraced beyond 1m2f but still commands respect
runners.spotlight: Four-time Group 1 winner, most recently when comfortably too good for Ensued and some of the others in this line-up over 1m2f in February; found game front-runner just too strong when odds-on for 1m Group 1 last month and has stamina to prove over this new trip but still commands respect.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Mile (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Voyage Bubble is a great horse in his own right. He felt excellent going to the gates today, he was really on the job. Credit to Ricky and his team, they've prepped him up beautifully. He just gives his all. He has a very big heart and he's very uncomplicated - James McDonald, rider.

runners.name: Dubai Honour
runners.comment: Second in HK Vase over C&D in December and a Group 1 winner in Australia since
runners.spotlight: Globretrotting British raider who was second over C&D in Group 1 Hong Kong Vase in December and returns having bagged a soft-ground Group 1 over today's trip in Australia last month; likely to make his presence felt.

quotes.race: Queen Elizabeth Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour has run a huge race in defeat and was beaten by a good mare. He had a horrible run round but whether it would have been enough to turn it around, I don't know - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Vase (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour was just a little bit keen early and Tom [Marquand] was keen to get him to settle, so he was well back. He has run a hell of a race on ground faster than he really likes, so you've got to be thrilled - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Grand Prix de Saint-Cloud (Group 1) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: The two Group 1s in Australia were fantastic but to win a Group 1 in Europe was important. Dubai Honour seemed to really enjoy himself today and looked to be travelling well all the way. The ground was probably a bit quick for him but maybe the trip [1m4f] on this ground is more suitable. He seemed to stay the trip really well which gives us another option. On the faster ground he gets this trip really well. William [Haggas] will decide where he goes but he's in lots of Group 1s all over the place. He's just a star of a horse and every time he gives his all. He's so good in his mind - assistant trainer Maureen Haggas.

quotes.race: Grand Prix de Chantilly (Group 2) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour got rushed over ten furlongs in Hong Kong where there's a short run to the first bend. Now he's shown he can go a mile and a half we might look at going back to Hong Kong for the Vase, a race in which they have the whole straight before the turn - Philip Robinson, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Magnolia Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour was a bit fresh and I think the run will have done him the world of good. He's such a grand horse, a sweet one, and that was good. It's nice to get his head back in front. He won a Group 1 only a year ago, but when you do those foreign trips, it takes time to get them back in the groove again. He needs to go after the money and is a slow-ground horse, but did win on faster last year. I think the plan is a Group 1 in Hong Kong on April 28 - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Queen Elizabeth Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour relaxed very well, and I knew when he relaxed well, he would pick up and he picked up well. Anamoe is a great horse, take nothing away from him, but this horse has come forward for being here and he's won well. I think Tom was keen to track Anamoe. The horse was prominent in the Ranvet which is not normally his style of running. He likes to come off the pace - William Haggas, trainer, speaking to Racing.com.

quotes.race: Ranvet Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very much worried about the track, but they assured me it was on the five side of a good four and Chris Waller told me it was fantastic, so we decided to gamble and run, and that was a great result. Dubai Honour had a great year in 2021 but he wasn't quite himself last year. However, he had a very, very good winter and I've been really happy with him - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour ran a really good race and he was just a bit unfortunate with how the race unfolded, which often happens there. When he got out and hit his stride he really came home well. This trip will have taught him a lot and hopefully we'll have a smart international performer on our hands next year - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco Champion Stakes (British Champions Middle Distance) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour ran a fantastic race. The draw didn't help and then he got a bit set alight. He came from quite a way back with a winning chance but the French horse was just too strong. We might now have a dart at Hong Kong - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour did that well off a gallop which was a bit stop start. He's going the right way and toughed it out - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour has probably been a bit of a slow learner and he did well to finish second at Chester, which is a tight track. He's improving all the time and is a nice horse for the future - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

runners.name: Cap Ferrat
runners.comment: Fifth in 1m2f Group 1 since winning HK Derby over that trip; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Improving 4yo who caused 26-1 surprise when driven out for narrow win in Hong Kong Derby here (1m2f) in March and was a very respectable fifth at Group 1 level last month; back up 1m4f for first time since his spell in Australia; considered each-way.

quotes.race: BMW Hong Kong Derby (Conditions) (4yo) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Cap Ferrat has never won a race ever until today and full credit has to go to Francis Lui and his team. I rode him three weeks ago and told them they had a lot of work to do as I thought he was really gross and full of himself. It was a big step to take and I thought he could place well, but the way he was presented here is the reason why we've won one of Hong Kong's greatest races - Craig Williams, jockey.

runners.name: Ensued
runners.comment: In the frame in three Group 1 races since 1m1f Group 3 win in November
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three Group 1 races (1m2f-1m4f) since winning 1m1f Group 3 handicap in November, most recently when fourth in last month's QEII Cup (1m2f); no surprise if he collects another minor prize today.

runners.name: Moments In Time
runners.comment: Excelled himself when placed in Group 2 two runs ago but faces tough task today
runners.spotlight: Excelled himself when close third in 1m Group 2 here in March and should be fine over today's longer trip but managed only seventh in Group 1 QEII Cup here (1m2f) last month and faces another tough task today.

runners.name: Rubylot
runners.owner: Hk Football Club Horse Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: Readily won Classic Cup over 1m1f here in March but has not really kicked on from that
runners.spotlight: Readily won the Classic Cup here (1m1f) in March but had to settle for fifth behind Cap Ferrat when warm favourite for Hong Kong Derby (1m2f) later that month and was behind that rival again (and Ensued) when sixth in 1m2f Group 1 last month; needs to find something extra over this new trip.

runners.name: Five G Patch
runners.comment: Often performs admirably in middle-distance Group races but others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Often performs admirably in middle-distance Group races but has not won since January 2023 and has not been at his best in recent months; others look much stronger.

quotes.race: Donate To The Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle In Honour Of Pat Smullen Race
quotes.quote: I know Joseph always thought Collins Street was a really nice horse. You could say that the other horse has thrown it away but Declan (McDonogh) said that, if anything, Max Mayhem hampered him a little. Once Collin Street picked Max up he galloped all the way to the line. Another furlong or two would suit - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Collins Street is a lovely horse. He was a bit backward last year but he has come to life. They went a good gallop and Shane thinks he could be exciting. He could do no more than win the way he did - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

runners.name: La City Blanche
runners.comment: Group 3 C&D winner last season but seems badly to have lost his way this year
runners.spotlight: Won C&D Group 3 handicap just over a year ago and has twice been placed at that level over 1m1f this season but seems badly to have lost his way since January.

runners.name: Winning Dragon
runners.owner: Alexander Yeung Kwok Kai, Edward Yeung Et Al
runners.comment: Excelled himself when fourth in 1m2f Group 1 in February but not in same form again since
runners.spotlight: Belied 46-1 odds when fourth to Voyage Bubble in 1m2f Group 1 here in February but has not been in quite the same form in four handicaps since, most recently when close third to Bundle Award in substandard C&D Group 3 three weeks ago.

runners.name: Bundle Award
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: C&D Group 3 handicap winner last month but that was a poor race for the level
runners.spotlight: Edged ahead close home to win C&D Group 3 handicap three weeks ago but that was a poor race for the level and he needs considerable further improvement on this Group 1 debut.

runners.name: We Are Hero

prev_owners.owner: J D Warren, M D Antill Et Al

runners.comment: Second over C&D last July but has not raced again since
runners.spotlight: 7yo who regressed last season; stayed on for C&D second off today's much reduced mark last July but has not raced again since.

runners.name: Stellar Express
runners.comment: Third when dropped to this grade at Happy Valley recently; remains on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Not really firing on all cylinders in recent months but appreciated drop to this grade when third of seven at Happy Valley 11 days ago and remains on a good mark.

runners.name: Dream Winner
runners.comment: Emerged from a slump in form to cause 65-1 surprise over C&D six weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Emerged from slump in form to cause 65-1 surprise over C&D six weeks ago; it's hard to predict whether he'll be in the right mood again today but a 7lb rise ought to be manageable if he is.

runners.name: Celestial Hero
runners.owner: Dr David Chain Chi Woo, Bernard Chain S Chiang & C C S Liang

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: 1-7 in Australia; makes Hong Kong debut after seven-month break; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 1-7 when based in Australia; absent since finishing fourth in 6f Listed race in October and probably best watched on this Hong Kong debut.

runners.name: Healthy Healthy
runners.owner: Lo Kui Lun, Lo Hoe Et Al
runners.comment: Dual 5f winner in late 2024 and back on a good mark now; a possible
runners.spotlight: Seemingly in the grip of the handicapper after his two 5f wins (one here) in late 2024 but is back on a good mark now and could have a part to play under James McDonald.

runners.name: Super Fortune
runners.comment: Front-runner; recently went close over 6f here; 5f also suits
runners.spotlight: Habitual front-runner who lost out only by a head over 6f here three weeks ago; now 9b higher than when scoring over C&D in December but no surprise if he gives this a good shot.

runners.name: Sir Charge
runners.owner: Boris Randolph Tanyu Van, Alex Cham Ho Yin Et Al
runners.comment: 2-2 over 5f in Australia last year; interesting to see how he fares on Hong King debut
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over 5f in Australia last year (maiden/handicap); makes Hong Kong debut after six-month break but it's very hard to gauge the limit of his ability; watch the betting.

runners.name: Lucky Twin Stars
runners.comment: Unable to pose a significant threat on recent Hong Kong debut (6f)
runners.spotlight: Won over 6.5f on debut in Australia but lacked the pace to pose a significant threat on recent Hong Kong debut (6f) and today's drop back to 5f is not an obvious move.

runners.name: Metro Power
runners.comment: Runner-up in two 6f maidens in Australia last year; makes Hong Kong debut today
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two 6f maidens in Australia last year; makes Hong Kong debut after six-month absence; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Justifying
runners.owner: Lau Sak Hong, Jimmy Wong Kwok Kin & Dr D L T Chak
runners.comment: Impressed over C&D on debut; beaten at skinny odds since but remains of strong interest
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who created very good impression when dominating from the front and winning very comfortably over C&D on debut in March; managed only fourth when 1-5 favourite in this higher grade last month and is drawn on the wing today but the first-time hood may help him to relax and he remains of strong interest.

runners.name: Northern Fire Ball
runners.comment: Dual 6f Class 4 winner this season; safely held in recent Class 3; not yet proven over 5f
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner in Class 4 at Happy Valley this season, latterly last month, but was safely held when upped to this grade there 11 days ago and needs to prove himself over 5f.

runners.name: All Round Winner
runners.owner: Clement Chan Kam Wing, Maggie Ho Sze Nga Et Al
runners.comment: Unable to land a telling blow over 6f on first three Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a telling blow over 6f on first three Hong Kong starts and will probably be of greater interest when dropped to Class 4.

runners.name: Alsonso

prev_owners.owner: Flemington Bloodstock, Yu Long Investments Et Al

runners.comment: Back up in grade today but has twice gone close over C&D in recent weeks
runners.spotlight: 0-8 in Hong Kong but well very close over C&D on his last two appearances and encountered some traffic on the more recent occasion; back up in grade today but still considered.

runners.name: Blazing Wind
runners.comment: Placed over 6f in first-time blinkers here a week ago; this drop back to 5f could suit
runners.spotlight: Scored over 6f in January and gave very good account when fourth over that trip a week ago, having raced freely in first-time blinkers; this drop back in trip could be a good move and he's nicely drawn against the nearside rail.

runners.name: Magic Hallow
runners.comment: Placed at triple-digit odds over C&D last month but well beaten over 6f since
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to take second at triple-digit odds over C&D last month, his third start, but was well beaten over 6f a week ago and now has it all to prove again.

runners.name: Withallmyfaith
runners.comment: Won three in a row over 1m in New Zealand in late 2024; opposable over 5f on HK debut
runners.spotlight: Signed off in New Zealand with hat-trick of 1m wins in November/December but may find 5f too sharp on this Hong Kong debut.
